Reference Summary: the project manager reviewed the minutes from the last meeting . the industrial designer discussed options for each of the internal components . he showed that the size of the chip was dependent on the type and number of additional features used . the group discussed incorporating speech recognition and other functions to be able to decide on chip size . they decided that using speech recognition for the locator function only would allow them to use a simple chip . the user interface designer presented several existing products . she presented a specialized children's remote; the group decided to focus on a basic remote that would appeal to a wide market . she expressed that buttons are often ambiguously shaped and that their remote must have an easy-to-use interface . the marketing expert presented trends in the remote control market and the fruit and vegetable and spongy material trends in fashion . the group discussed ways to incorporate these trends . they decided to make the standby button shaped like an apple , to use a rubber case and buttons , and to use a single-curved shape . the project manager instructed the user interface designer and the industrial designer to construct the prototype . the user interface designer and the industrial designer will construct the prototype . the group decided to use speech recognition but only for the locator function . the remote will feature push buttons instead of scroll buttons , and a kinetic power supply . the remote will contain a simple chip . the group decided to focus on a basic remote that will appeal to the widest market . they also decided to market the speech recognition component as a "finder function" so as not to confuse it with more advanced speech recognition components in other remote controls . the group decided to make the standby button in the shape of an apple . the remote will also feature a rubber case and rubber buttons , and a single-curved design . the remote will feature the company logo , possibly in a sticker form .
Generated Summary: the industrial designer presented the options for components and materials that would have to be changed in order to maintain the appearance of the prototype . he discussed the costs involved in adding speech recognition , an lcd screen , and a kinetic battery . the marketing expert presented consumer preferences and requirements and the prototype was evaluated on a scale of 1(excellent)-7(very bad). the user interface designer presented the prototype to the group and discussed the layout of the interface . the group then discussed the color scheme of the device . the group decided to use the company logo in the design of the device . the project manager reviewed the minutes of the previous meeting . the group discussed the costs involved in adding speech recognition , an lcd screen , and a kinetic battery , as well as the layout of the interface . the project manager instructed the user interface designer to construct the prototype , the marketing expert to prepare the prototype evaluation , and the industrial designer to construct the case for the device . the user interface designer will construct the prototype . the marketing expert will prepare the evaluation . the group decided to use the company logo in the design of the device . the remote will not feature speech recognition . the remote will have a kinetic battery . the remote will have a scroll wheel . the buttons will be push-button-up and down . the lcd screen will be on the remote . the case will be made of rubber .

Reference Summary: the project manager reviewed the minutes from the last meeting . the industrial designer discussed options for each of the internal components . he showed that the size of the chip was dependent on the type and number of additional features used . the group discussed incorporating speech recognition and other functions to be able to decide on chip size . they decided that using speech recognition for the locator function only would allow them to use a simple chip . the user interface designer presented several existing products . she presented a specialized children's remote; the group decided to focus on a basic remote that would appeal to a wide market . she expressed that buttons are often ambiguously shaped and that their remote must have an easy-to-use interface . the marketing expert presented trends in the remote control market and the fruit and vegetable and spongy material trends in fashion . the group discussed ways to incorporate these trends . they decided to make the standby button shaped like an apple , to use a rubber case and buttons , and to use a single-curved shape . the project manager instructed the user interface designer and the industrial designer to construct the prototype . the user interface designer and the industrial designer will construct the prototype . the group decided to use speech recognition but only for the locator function . the remote will feature push buttons instead of scroll buttons , and a kinetic power supply . the remote will contain a simple chip . the group decided to focus on a basic remote that will appeal to the widest market . they also decided to market the speech recognition component as a "finder function" so as not to confuse it with more advanced speech recognition components in other remote controls . the group decided to make the standby button in the shape of an apple . the remote will also feature a rubber case and rubber buttons , and a single-curved design . the remote will feature the company logo , possibly in a sticker form .
Generated Summary: the industrial designer presented the options for components and materials that would be needed to produce the remote device and discussed the costs involved in each component . the marketing expert discussed customer preferences in terms of features to include in the remote . she indicated that customers wanted speech recognition , an lcd display , a scroll mechanism for locating the remote when misplaced , and a power source that was capable of generating a kinetic response . the user interface designer presented existing remotes to exemplify the interface that the remote should have . she suggested that the company logo should be incorporated into the design of the remote . the project manager reviewed the minutes of the previous meeting and discussed the decisions made in the meeting . the group then discussed the features to include in the remote and the costs involved in each component . the industrial designer will work on the look and feel of the design . the user interface designer will work on the user interface design . the marketing expert will work on the product evaluation . the remote will feature speech recognition , an lcd display , a scroll mechanism for locating the remote when misplaced , and a power source capable of generating a kinetic response . the company logo will be incorporated into the design of the remote . the remote will have buttons for changing the channel , volume , and number buttons . the remote will have a scroll mechanism for locating the remote when misplaced . the remote will have an lcd display . the remote will have a power source capable of generating a kinetic response . the remote will have an integrated push button .

Reference Summary: the first prototype for the remote control was made of single-curved rubber with a total of 16 rubber buttons (some of them in a slide-out panel) with a cherry design on top . it uses kinetic energy and has a sample sensor for the speech recognition . the initial cost was calculated at 13.70 euros . although over budget , the team decided to evaluate this prototype before making any changes . on a scale from 1 (true) to 7 (false) they rated it on the basis of the following criteria: fancy design (2) , technological innovation (2) , ease of use (1) , incorporation of fashion elements (2) , and brand recognition (2). changing the rubber case to plastic reduced the cost and allowed for an extra button-form and colour . the team were reasonably satisfied with the project in terms of teamwork and creativity , although they thought that the flow of information was sometimes disjointed . however , the idea of designing a remote control seemed unexciting , especially since the requirements restricted it to tv only , and the budget was too small . finally , some new ideas were also found in the form of kinetic energy source and use of speech recognition . the team have two questionnaires and a report on the last meeting to complete before they finish . the remote will be single-curved with a cherry design on top . the case will be made of plastic . the buttons will be made of rubber mostly in a light blue colour . however , volume and channel buttons will be different from the rest . volume buttons will be lemon-shaped and coloured . a slide-out panel with extra buttons for less-used functions is included . the buttons in this panel will all be in the standard blue colour . a simple chip is going to support the electronics of the device . a sample sensor was included to add speech recognition . the remote is going to be powered by kinetic energy . after changing the case material from rubber to plastic , it was debated that the loss of sponginess does affect the fancy appeal and trendiness of the remote . on the other hand , it was argued that the special colours and form compensated for that . the team were not certain to what extent the prototype satisfied recognisability of the corporate identity . they were not certain what the colour of the company logo should be and how the logo should be displayed .
Generated Summary: the user interface designer and the industrial designer presented their prototype to the group . it featured an apple-inspired design , with removable buttons for volume and mute . the prototype was evaluated on the basis of its attractiveness to the user , cost , and generalizability . the group decided that the prototype met enough of these initial criteria to be able to market the product . the marketing expert led an evaluation of the prototype . the group found that , although the design was attractive , its size and shape did not meet enough of their initial criteria to be able to be marketed . they rated the prototype highly on the basis of its attractiveness to the user , cost , and generalizability . the project manager recapped the decisions made in the meeting . the group decided that , although the prototype was attractive , its size and shape did not meet enough of their initial criteria to be able to be marketed . they rated the project highly on the basis of its attractiveness to the public , cost , and generalizability . the group decided that , although the design was attractive , its size and shape did not meet enough of their initial criteria to be able to be marketed . the group did not think the prototype met enough of their initial criteria to be able to be marketed . the group felt that , although the design was attractive , its size and shape did not meet enough of their initial criteria

Reference Summary: the first prototype for the remote control was made of single-curved rubber with a total of 16 rubber buttons (some of them in a slide-out panel) with a cherry design on top . it uses kinetic energy and has a sample sensor for the speech recognition . the initial cost was calculated at 13.70 euros . although over budget , the team decided to evaluate this prototype before making any changes . on a scale from 1 (true) to 7 (false) they rated it on the basis of the following criteria: fancy design (2) , technological innovation (2) , ease of use (1) , incorporation of fashion elements (2) , and brand recognition (2). changing the rubber case to plastic reduced the cost and allowed for an extra button-form and colour . the team were reasonably satisfied with the project in terms of teamwork and creativity , although they thought that the flow of information was sometimes disjointed . however , the idea of designing a remote control seemed unexciting , especially since the requirements restricted it to tv only , and the budget was too small . finally , some new ideas were also found in the form of kinetic energy source and use of speech recognition . the team have two questionnaires and a report on the last meeting to complete before they finish . the remote will be single-curved with a cherry design on top . the case will be made of plastic . the buttons will be made of rubber mostly in a light blue colour . however , volume and channel buttons will be different from the rest . volume buttons will be lemon-shaped and coloured . a slide-out panel with extra buttons for less-used functions is included . the buttons in this panel will all be in the standard blue colour . a simple chip is going to support the electronics of the device . a sample sensor was included to add speech recognition . the remote is going to be powered by kinetic energy . after changing the case material from rubber to plastic , it was debated that the loss of sponginess does affect the fancy appeal and trendiness of the remote . on the other hand , it was argued that the special colours and form compensated for that . the team were not certain to what extent the prototype satisfied recognisability of the corporate identity . they were not certain what the colour of the company logo should be and how the logo should be displayed .
Generated Summary: the user interface designer and the industrial designer presented the prototype to the group . the group evaluated the prototype on the basis of the criteria set out in the previous meeting . they found that the prototype met all the criteria except for the fact that it did not have a slide-away function . it also did not include the company logo , but did include an apple slash cherry design , volume buttons in orange and channel buttons in blue , and a stick on the button with the company's logo . there was no change in the design of the buttons , which were not satisfied the project process , although the prototype did not meet all the requirements of the project finances .

Reference Summary: the first prototype for the remote control was made of single-curved rubber with a total of 16 rubber buttons (some of them in a slide-out panel) with a cherry design on top . it uses kinetic energy and has a sample sensor for the speech recognition . the initial cost was calculated at 13.70 euros . although over budget , the team decided to evaluate this prototype before making any changes . on a scale from 1 (true) to 7 (false) they rated it on the basis of the following criteria: fancy design (2) , technological innovation (2) , ease of use (1) , incorporation of fashion elements (2) , and brand recognition (2). changing the rubber case to plastic reduced the cost and allowed for an extra button-form and colour . the team were reasonably satisfied with the project in terms of teamwork and creativity , although they thought that the flow of information was sometimes disjointed . however , the idea of designing a remote control seemed unexciting , especially since the requirements restricted it to tv only , and the budget was too small . finally , some new ideas were also found in the form of kinetic energy source and use of speech recognition . the team have two questionnaires and a report on the last meeting to complete before they finish . the remote will be single-curved with a cherry design on top . the case will be made of plastic . the buttons will be made of rubber mostly in a light blue colour . however , volume and channel buttons will be different from the rest . volume buttons will be lemon-shaped and coloured . a slide-out panel with extra buttons for less-used functions is included . the buttons in this panel will all be in the standard blue colour . a simple chip is going to support the electronics of the device . a sample sensor was included to add speech recognition . the remote is going to be powered by kinetic energy . after changing the case material from rubber to plastic , it was debated that the loss of sponginess does affect the fancy appeal and trendiness of the remote . on the other hand , it was argued that the special colours and form compensated for that . the team were not certain to what extent the prototype satisfied recognisability of the corporate identity . they were not certain what the colour of the company logo should be and how the logo should be displayed .
Generated Summary: the project manager reviewed the minutes from the previous meeting . the user interface designer and the industrial designer presented their prototype and displayed the changeable fruit and vegetable designs . they also discussed the colour options for the buttons . the marketing expert gave an evaluation of the prototype based on the criteria of attractiveness , whether it matches operation behavior of the user , technological innovation , ease of use , and its ability to be misplaced . the group decided that enough of their initial ideas and criteria for the prototype were satisfied to be able to continue with the project . the finance expert led the team in calculating the production cost of the device . the total cost came to 12.2 euros , although this did not include the cost of various components which were not on the price list . the team decided to remove the sample speaker and the scroll wheel from the design in order to keep the price point close to the original goal . the project Manager led a discussion on the project process . the participants felt that they worked well together and were pleased with the tools available to them . they complained , though , that they felt constrained by the management's directives , that there was not enough information provided to them , and that they had difficulties using the meeting-room equipment . all participants were instructed to fill out a final questionnaire and to return to their workspace . the designers will fill out the final questionnaire . the industrial and user interface designers will work on a drawing of a prototype . the remote will be made of plastic instead of rubber . the change

Reference Summary: the first prototype for the remote control was made of single-curved rubber with a total of 16 rubber buttons (some of them in a slide-out panel) with a cherry design on top . it uses kinetic energy and has a sample sensor for the speech recognition . the initial cost was calculated at 13.70 euros . although over budget , the team decided to evaluate this prototype before making any changes . on a scale from 1 (true) to 7 (false) they rated it on the basis of the following criteria: fancy design (2) , technological innovation (2) , ease of use (1) , incorporation of fashion elements (2) , and brand recognition (2). changing the rubber case to plastic reduced the cost and allowed for an extra button-form and colour . the team were reasonably satisfied with the project in terms of teamwork and creativity , although they thought that the flow of information was sometimes disjointed . however , the idea of designing a remote control seemed unexciting , especially since the requirements restricted it to tv only , and the budget was too small . finally , some new ideas were also found in the form of kinetic energy source and use of speech recognition . the team have two questionnaires and a report on the last meeting to complete before they finish . the remote will be single-curved with a cherry design on top . the case will be made of plastic . the buttons will be made of rubber mostly in a light blue colour . however , volume and channel buttons will be different from the rest . volume buttons will be lemon-shaped and coloured . a slide-out panel with extra buttons for less-used functions is included . the buttons in this panel will all be in the standard blue colour . a simple chip is going to support the electronics of the device . a sample sensor was included to add speech recognition . the remote is going to be powered by kinetic energy . after changing the case material from rubber to plastic , it was debated that the loss of sponginess does affect the fancy appeal and trendiness of the remote . on the other hand , it was argued that the special colours and form compensated for that . the team were not certain to what extent the prototype satisfied recognisability of the corporate identity . they were not certain what the colour of the company logo should be and how the logo should be displayed .
Generated Summary: the user interface designer and the industrial designer presented the prototype to the group . they displayed the prototype at the front of the device , with the company logo at the top , and two cherry-shaped buttons . the group discussed the options for buttons , including one with a curved shape , which may be shaped like an apple , or one that is more fruit-themed . their group discussed whether to include a second layer of plastic for the back button . after a discussion on the merits of the prototype , the project manager went over the requirements for the device and found that it met all of the criteria established that the project had very good quality and design , although this did not have enough resources to be able to be fruit and vegetables in which they had difficulties with getting the necessary information from their computer and marketing expert advising them to write up their product evaluation . all participants were instructed to write down their initial criteria in order to have a final report at the end of the meeting and to complete the final questionnaire . each participant will write up his/her presentation and the final report the group decided that the prototype will be double-curved . there will be extra buttons plus and a cherry-themed remote . it will be made of rubber , so that the curved , in orange and blue and red apples , but not be enough material to write in small letters to help people understand the project process .

Reference Summary: the first prototype for the remote control was made of single-curved rubber with a total of 16 rubber buttons (some of them in a slide-out panel) with a cherry design on top . it uses kinetic energy and has a sample sensor for the speech recognition . the initial cost was calculated at 13.70 euros . although over budget , the team decided to evaluate this prototype before making any changes . on a scale from 1 (true) to 7 (false) they rated it on the basis of the following criteria: fancy design (2) , technological innovation (2) , ease of use (1) , incorporation of fashion elements (2) , and brand recognition (2). changing the rubber case to plastic reduced the cost and allowed for an extra button-form and colour . the team were reasonably satisfied with the project in terms of teamwork and creativity , although they thought that the flow of information was sometimes disjointed . however , the idea of designing a remote control seemed unexciting , especially since the requirements restricted it to tv only , and the budget was too small . finally , some new ideas were also found in the form of kinetic energy source and use of speech recognition . the team have two questionnaires and a report on the last meeting to complete before they finish . the remote will be single-curved with a cherry design on top . the case will be made of plastic . the buttons will be made of rubber mostly in a light blue colour . however , volume and channel buttons will be different from the rest . volume buttons will be lemon-shaped and coloured . a slide-out panel with extra buttons for less-used functions is included . the buttons in this panel will all be in the standard blue colour . a simple chip is going to support the electronics of the device . a sample sensor was included to add speech recognition . the remote is going to be powered by kinetic energy . after changing the case material from rubber to plastic , it was debated that the loss of sponginess does affect the fancy appeal and trendiness of the remote . on the other hand , it was argued that the special colours and form compensated for that . the team were not certain to what extent the prototype satisfied recognisability of the corporate identity . they were not certain what the colour of the company logo should be and how the logo should be displayed .
Generated Summary: the user interface designer and the industrial designer presented their prototype to the group . it featured an apple-like design with a cherry-like logo . the prototype was evaluated on a scale of 1(excellent)-7(very bad). the project manager discussed the final cost with the group; after an analysis of all of the components , the final cost was lower than initially projected . the group then evaluated the prototype on a scale of 1(excellent)-7(very bad). the group decided that the prototype met enough of the initial project criteria to be able to market the product . the project manager led an evaluation of the project process . the group felt that they worked well together and that they had room to be creative . they complained that they had difficulties using the meeting-room equipment , and the project manager advised them to delete all of their personal documents from the meeting-room computer and to use the internet instead . the project manager instructed the marketing expert to report on the project process; the marketing executive found the meeting-room equipment to be satisfactory and the group had room to be creative . the group decided that the prototype met enough of the initial project criteria to be able to market the product . the group had problems with some of the meeting-room equipment . the group complained that they had difficulties using the meeting-room computer and had to delete all of their personal documents from the meeting-room computer . the project manager instructed the marketing expert to report on the project process . the group had problems with some of the meeting-

Reference Summary: the first prototype for the remote control was made of single-curved rubber with a total of 16 rubber buttons (some of them in a slide-out panel) with a cherry design on top . it uses kinetic energy and has a sample sensor for the speech recognition . the initial cost was calculated at 13.70 euros . although over budget , the team decided to evaluate this prototype before making any changes . on a scale from 1 (true) to 7 (false) they rated it on the basis of the following criteria: fancy design (2) , technological innovation (2) , ease of use (1) , incorporation of fashion elements (2) , and brand recognition (2). changing the rubber case to plastic reduced the cost and allowed for an extra button-form and colour . the team were reasonably satisfied with the project in terms of teamwork and creativity , although they thought that the flow of information was sometimes disjointed . however , the idea of designing a remote control seemed unexciting , especially since the requirements restricted it to tv only , and the budget was too small . finally , some new ideas were also found in the form of kinetic energy source and use of speech recognition . the team have two questionnaires and a report on the last meeting to complete before they finish . the remote will be single-curved with a cherry design on top . the case will be made of plastic . the buttons will be made of rubber mostly in a light blue colour . however , volume and channel buttons will be different from the rest . volume buttons will be lemon-shaped and coloured . a slide-out panel with extra buttons for less-used functions is included . the buttons in this panel will all be in the standard blue colour . a simple chip is going to support the electronics of the device . a sample sensor was included to add speech recognition . the remote is going to be powered by kinetic energy . after changing the case material from rubber to plastic , it was debated that the loss of sponginess does affect the fancy appeal and trendiness of the remote . on the other hand , it was argued that the special colours and form compensated for that . the team were not certain to what extent the prototype satisfied recognisability of the corporate identity . they were not certain what the colour of the company logo should be and how the logo should be displayed .
Generated Summary: the project manager reviewed the minutes from the previous meeting . the user interface designer and the industrial designer presented the prototype and displayed the changeable fruit and vegetable designs . they also discussed the mute component and the colour options . the marketing expert gave an evaluation of the prototype based on the initial criteria of attractiveness , whether it matches operation behavior of the user , locatability , ergonomic design , and its ability to be misplaced . the group decided that enough of their initial ideas and criteria for the prototype were satisfied to be able to continue with the project . the finance manager analyzed the production cost of the device; the cost was lower than initially projected , at 11.2 euros . it was decided that the device could be used for 12.5 euros instead of the original 12.3 euros . the team then discussed the option to include a second layer of rubber in the design , which was also decided against . the meeting was adjourned without any decisions made about the prototype or the production costs . the next meeting will be to complete the final questionaire and meeting summary . the remote will be made of plastic with rubber changeable covers . the devices will come in different colours: apple , cherry , and zebra . the corporate logo will be on the remote . the buttons will be black/yellow and the company colours will be displayed through the cutouts in the plastic . the device was designed and made with a latex product with a rubbery texture . the prototype was evaluated on a scale of 1

Generated Summary: the project manager introduced the upcoming project to the group and gave an agenda for the project as a whole . the group acquainted themselves with the meeting-room tools by drawing on the white board . the project Manager presented the project budget and the projected profit aim , the production cost , and the price point of the device . the team then began a discussion about features of remote controls and their own experiences with them . they discussed making the remote universally compatible and ergonomically-designed , and types of batteries to use . the manager instructed the industrial designer to work on the working design , the user interface designer to look at the technical functions , andthe marketing expert to figure out the selling prices of the remote . the official logo of the company will be displayed on the product . the prototype will be sold for 25 euro . the profit aim will be 50 million euros . the remote will have a worldwide appeal . the marketing expert will figure out how to market the remote to customers who cannot currently find a remote in their local stores . the corporate color and slogan must be featured on the television display . the device will have an ergonomic design and will use a regular chip . size of battery . whether to use a recharging stand or not . how to make the remote look more unique .

Reference Summary: the meeting opens with the group doing introductions by giving their name and role . betty is the project manager , francina is the user interface specialist , eileen is the marketing expert , and jeanne is the industrial designer . the project manager tells them they will be designing a new remote control that should be original , trendy , and user-friendly . they will be concerned with functional , conceptional , and detailed design . to try out the whiteboard , each group member draws her favorite animal on the board . they discuss the project budget and then talk about their experiences with remote controls . they seemed to agree that the remote should be compact and have a multi-purpose functions . they also agree that it should do something different that current controls cannot do and that it should be made of different colors , materials , and shapes . they also discuss a way of helping people find the remote when it is lost- a signal , whether it is a beep or light . then they close the meeting with the project manager going over the tasks they are to complete and telling them they will meet again in about thirty minutes . the industrial designer will work on the working design and technical function . the interface specialist will do the working design and functional design . the marketing manager will look for user requirement specifications such as friendliness selling price will be twenty five euro . company aims to profit fifty million euro . it should be compact , multi-functional , different in shape/color/material . have a locator to help find the remote when it is lost . the group if not sure if they will have the budget to make the gadget multi-functional , but they would like to make one that would control basically all household machines .
Generated Summary: the project manager introduced the upcoming project to the team and then the team members participated in an exercise in which they drew their favorite animals on the white board and discussed why they liked those particular animals . the project manger talked about the project finances and the selling price of the remote is 25 euro ; the profit aim is 50 million euro , the range is unlimited and the production cost should be under 12 euro . after they finished the drawing exercise they discussed what features they would like to see in the remote , and discussed whether the remote should have a new design or if it should be multifunctional or just for televisions . they discussed changing the existing remote could be used only for TVs , but decided it was not necessary to include speech recognition . there was some confusion about what the remote was actually doing when lost and how to locate it .

Reference Summary: the meeting begins and the marketing expert starts her presentation promptly , telling them that her research shows they need a focus- it is not possible to make a device that works on the whole house . the project manager steps in and informs them that they have instructions to eliminate the teletext idea because it is too complicated , and also said they must maintain the corporate image by using corporate designs and colors . the marketing expert resumes , talking about how remotes often get lost and that a light emitter might be useful . the industrial designer gives her presentation , talking about components , materials , and energy sources . they discuss giving the control different shapes to suit both adults and children , making the buttons various shapes , and putting a display clock on the control . the interface designer presents , talking about the features users like on a remote and suggesting that they make the remote a t-shape and add an alarm clock function . they discuss their target group and the possibility of removable plastic cases . they close the meeting deciding to do more research on the plastic cases . they cannot make a device that works on the whole house- will need a focus . they will eliminate teletext . they will maintain the corporate image by using the proper designs and colors . their target group is basically everybody who owns a tv . they are concerned about making the control marketable to a wide range of age groups , and have discussed making removable plastic covers so that the look is changeable . however , they need to do more research on this topic . they do not know if their budget will allow them to include all the features they would like to such as a light emitter , clock , alarm clock , and child lock .
Generated Summary: the project manager introduced the project to the group and gave the group instructions as to what they would do before the next meeting . the industrial designer discussed the interior workings of a remote and the team discussed various features they could include in order to make the remote more user-friendly . the marketing expert presented consumer preferences and requirements and discussed the possibility of including an lcd screen . the user interface designer presented existing remote controls on the market and discussed what features in terms of appearance and functionality the remote the team is creating should include . the group discussed the features they would like to include in the remote . they discussed including a battery charging stand with the remote but decided that it was not a feature they wanted to include . they also discussed how to incorporate a fruit and vegetable theme into the design . the team decided that the remote will be small with a locator function instead of having a charging stand . they had some difficulties figuring out the cost of adding a feature to the remote and eventually decided that they could not afford it . they did not have time to evaluate the project process before the end of the meeting .

Reference Summary: the meeting begins and the marketing expert starts her presentation promptly , telling them that her research shows they need a focus- it is not possible to make a device that works on the whole house . the project manager steps in and informs them that they have instructions to eliminate the teletext idea because it is too complicated , and also said they must maintain the corporate image by using corporate designs and colors . the marketing expert resumes , talking about how remotes often get lost and that a light emitter might be useful . the industrial designer gives her presentation , talking about components , materials , and energy sources . they discuss giving the control different shapes to suit both adults and children , making the buttons various shapes , and putting a display clock on the control . the interface designer presents , talking about the features users like on a remote and suggesting that they make the remote a t-shape and add an alarm clock function . they discuss their target group and the possibility of removable plastic cases . they close the meeting deciding to do more research on the plastic cases . they cannot make a device that works on the whole house- will need a focus . they will eliminate teletext . they will maintain the corporate image by using the proper designs and colors . their target group is basically everybody who owns a tv . they are concerned about making the control marketable to a wide range of age groups , and have discussed making removable plastic covers so that the look is changeable . however , they need to do more research on this topic . they do not know if their budget will allow them to include all the features they would like to such as a light emitter , clock , alarm clock , and child lock .
Generated Summary: the project manager introduced the upcoming project to the group and gave the agenda for the rest of the project . the group introduced themselves to each other and trained themselves how to use the meeting room equipment . the marketing expert began presenting research on consumer preferences and requirements for remotes . she discussed making the remote universally compatible and ergonomically-designed , and suggested including a battery charging stand with the remote . the industrial designer presented his internal design of the device and discussed the restrictions involved in combining various components . the interface specialist presented the requirements of users and presented several ideas for the device . she suggested including an lcd screen and a base station with a locator function . the program manager gave the group their assignments and instructed them to work together on the project evaluation . all participants participated in a discussion in which they discussed their experiences with remotes and what features they would like to see in the remote the remote control will have . the team discussed the features that will be incorporated into the remote and decided that the remote will be moderately-sized and will not have a large number of buttons . the manager instructed the user interface designer to work on the technical functions of the remote , and the marketing specialist to prepare a trendwatching report . the user Interface designer will work on what functions the remote controls have and will try to find the most user-friendly settings possible . the remote manager will prepare a report containing the summary of the meeting proceedings , including the evaluation of the group's work together . the industial

Reference Summary: the meeting begins and the marketing expert starts her presentation promptly , telling them that her research shows they need a focus- it is not possible to make a device that works on the whole house . the project manager steps in and informs them that they have instructions to eliminate the teletext idea because it is too complicated , and also said they must maintain the corporate image by using corporate designs and colors . the marketing expert resumes , talking about how remotes often get lost and that a light emitter might be useful . the industrial designer gives her presentation , talking about components , materials , and energy sources . they discuss giving the control different shapes to suit both adults and children , making the buttons various shapes , and putting a display clock on the control . the interface designer presents , talking about the features users like on a remote and suggesting that they make the remote a t-shape and add an alarm clock function . they discuss their target group and the possibility of removable plastic cases . they close the meeting deciding to do more research on the plastic cases . they cannot make a device that works on the whole house- will need a focus . they will eliminate teletext . they will maintain the corporate image by using the proper designs and colors . their target group is basically everybody who owns a tv . they are concerned about making the control marketable to a wide range of age groups , and have discussed making removable plastic covers so that the look is changeable . however , they need to do more research on this topic . they do not know if their budget will allow them to include all the features they would like to such as a light emitter , clock , alarm clock , and child lock .
Generated Summary: the marketing expert introduced himself to the group and discussed his role in the project . he discussed the needs and desires of the target group . the industrial designer discussed the costs and time involved in developing the product , and the user interface designer discussed what features the product should include and what features should be prioritized based on their appeal to target groups . they discussed the look and feel of the product and decided that a whole house design was not feasible within the budget . after a discussion of the features to include , the group decided that the design should include in the product to be sold as , it should be attractive , be able , have a spongy feel , has to be a touch-screen display , a button to make it easy to use , but it is not possible to put in a pocket-friendly design .

Reference Summary: the meeting begins and the marketing expert starts her presentation promptly , telling them that her research shows they need a focus- it is not possible to make a device that works on the whole house . the project manager steps in and informs them that they have instructions to eliminate the teletext idea because it is too complicated , and also said they must maintain the corporate image by using corporate designs and colors . the marketing expert resumes , talking about how remotes often get lost and that a light emitter might be useful . the industrial designer gives her presentation , talking about components , materials , and energy sources . they discuss giving the control different shapes to suit both adults and children , making the buttons various shapes , and putting a display clock on the control . the interface designer presents , talking about the features users like on a remote and suggesting that they make the remote a t-shape and add an alarm clock function . they discuss their target group and the possibility of removable plastic cases . they close the meeting deciding to do more research on the plastic cases . they cannot make a device that works on the whole house- will need a focus . they will eliminate teletext . they will maintain the corporate image by using the proper designs and colors . their target group is basically everybody who owns a tv . they are concerned about making the control marketable to a wide range of age groups , and have discussed making removable plastic covers so that the look is changeable . however , they need to do more research on this topic . they do not know if their budget will allow them to include all the features they would like to such as a light emitter , clock , alarm clock , and child lock .

Reference Summary: the meeting begins and the marketing expert starts her presentation promptly , telling them that her research shows they need a focus- it is not possible to make a device that works on the whole house . the project manager steps in and informs them that they have instructions to eliminate the teletext idea because it is too complicated , and also said they must maintain the corporate image by using corporate designs and colors . the marketing expert resumes , talking about how remotes often get lost and that a light emitter might be useful . the industrial designer gives her presentation , talking about components , materials , and energy sources . they discuss giving the control different shapes to suit both adults and children , making the buttons various shapes , and putting a display clock on the control . the interface designer presents , talking about the features users like on a remote and suggesting that they make the remote a t-shape and add an alarm clock function . they discuss their target group and the possibility of removable plastic cases . they close the meeting deciding to do more research on the plastic cases . they cannot make a device that works on the whole house- will need a focus . they will eliminate teletext . they will maintain the corporate image by using the proper designs and colors . their target group is basically everybody who owns a tv . they are concerned about making the control marketable to a wide range of age groups , and have discussed making removable plastic covers so that the look is changeable . however , they need to do more research on this topic . they do not know if their budget will allow them to include all the features they would like to such as a light emitter , clock , alarm clock , and child lock .
Generated Summary: the marketing expert presented the product requirements to the group . he discussed how to create a product that is attractive , functional , and affordable . the industrial designer discussed the possible components and how to make a case for the device so it can be used as a stand . she discussed the cost and time involved in constructing the device ; the project manager discussed the projected budget and the group decided on several different options based on their initial ideas of what they wanted to do and the available products on the market . they discussed the attractiveness of the device and the need for special functions that would require a special shape or color to make the device stand out of its ability to be a spongy . when it became apparent that the group had difficulties in meeting the management's directives and led them in deciding on what could be done in order to keep the project within the budget . all participants were instructed to work on their individual tasks and then instructed to prepare a final report at the end of the meeting . after the group discussed deciding what functions and materials to include . it was decided that the device would come in a specially designed and will not include a locator function . there will be no longer be room for decoration , since it will be only one color and not be able to have a conversation about what functions would be included .

Reference Summary: the meeting begins and the marketing expert starts her presentation promptly , telling them that her research shows they need a focus- it is not possible to make a device that works on the whole house . the project manager steps in and informs them that they have instructions to eliminate the teletext idea because it is too complicated , and also said they must maintain the corporate image by using corporate designs and colors . the marketing expert resumes , talking about how remotes often get lost and that a light emitter might be useful . the industrial designer gives her presentation , talking about components , materials , and energy sources . they discuss giving the control different shapes to suit both adults and children , making the buttons various shapes , and putting a display clock on the control . the interface designer presents , talking about the features users like on a remote and suggesting that they make the remote a t-shape and add an alarm clock function . they discuss their target group and the possibility of removable plastic cases . they close the meeting deciding to do more research on the plastic cases . they cannot make a device that works on the whole house- will need a focus . they will eliminate teletext . they will maintain the corporate image by using the proper designs and colors . their target group is basically everybody who owns a tv . they are concerned about making the control marketable to a wide range of age groups , and have discussed making removable plastic covers so that the look is changeable . however , they need to do more research on this topic . they do not know if their budget will allow them to include all the features they would like to such as a light emitter , clock , alarm clock , and child lock .
Generated Summary: the project manager opens the meeting by stating that they will address the needs and desires of the user as well as the functional requirements of the device . the user interface designer gives her initial presentation , addressing the needs and desires of the user as well as the budget constraints involved in creating such a device . she lists the most frequently asked questions such as what functions should be included , how to find them when misplaced , what color the device should be , and what features to include in order to meet these needs . the marketing expert presents , talking about the importance of finding a product that is both unique and appealing to the consumer as well as meeting the needs of a particular demographic . he suggests that the product should be yellow or glow in the dark in order to attract the consumer's attention . the project manager closes the meeting . the industrial designer presents , addressing the functional requirements of the device as well as the budget constraints involved in creating such a device . he lists the most frequently asked questions such as what functions should be included , how to find them when misplaced , what color the device should be , and what features to include in order to meet these needs . the marketing expert presents , talking about the importance of finding a product that is both unique and appealing to the consumer as well as meeting the needs of a particular demographic . he suggests that the product should be yellow or glow in the dark in order to attract the consumer's attention . the project manager closes the meeting by thanking each participant . the

Reference Summary: the project manager opens the meeting by going over the minutes of the last meeting , detailing the main points of each person's presentation . they do the prototype presentation which includes a model of the remote control . the group discusses this proposed model , approving of the small size and look of it . they goes over finances and are pleased to find that they are well within budget . however , while the marketing expert is doing the product evaulation the group realizes that they neglected to calculate voice recognition into the financing . their cost had been 8.20 euros and they have  4.30 left to cover it , so they decide to settle for whatever quality it will buy . they rate their product on its shape , size , color , feel , and functionality . they discuss the project process , talk briefly about adding more features , and one member suggests eliminating a mute buttons and include a diffferent feature . they are happy with the creativity , leadership , and teamwork within the group , and close the meeting by thanking one another . the remote is a snail shape with bright colors , blue and yellow with multi-colored buttons . compact in size . it includes a remote holder in the shape of a shell . the case will be made of plastic and the buttons of soft rubber . its features will include an on/off button , two mute buttons , nine channel buttons , two buttons for increasing/decreasing the volume , two buttons for scrolling up/down channels , a menu button in the center which controls the color/sharpness/brightness of the picture , and a swapping button . channel buttons numbered , rest of the buttons have symbols indicating function . light emitting diode is flourescent green . in their cost evaluation they got 8.20 , not factoring in the voice recognition feature . they decide to settle for the level of quality the remaining 4.30 euros will get them . the group spent 8.20 euros on their product , but they almost forgot to factor in voice recognition , which may cost more than the 4.30 euros remaining . they will have to settle for whatever level of quality that 4.30 euros can buy .
Generated Summary: the user interface designer presented her personal preference for the look and feel of the product and emphasized the importance of having nine channel buttons , a next button , volume and mute buttons , a switch to control other devices such as dvds and mp3 players , and a feature to locate a misplaced remote . she also stressed the need for a case made of plastic that is easy to use and not harmful to the environment . the industrial designer discussed the energy source and components that should be integrated and stressed the need for a battery capable of powering the device . the marketing expert conducted a product evaluation of the prototype using the information gathered during the previous meeting . the evaluation showed that the prototype was very user-friendly and had lots of innovative features . the industrial designer and user interface designer will work together on a prototype drawing of the remote the remote will not include speech recognition . the case should be made of plastic that is easy to use and not harmful to the environment . the remote will have a battery capable of powering the device . the remote will have nine channel buttons , a next button , volume and mute buttons , a switch to control other devices such as dvds and mp3 players , and a feature to locate a misplaced remote . the industrial designer and user interface designer will work together on a prototype drawing of the remote the remote will not include speech recognition . the case should be made of plastic that is easy to use and not harmful to the environment . the remote will have a battery capable of powering the device .

Reference Summary: the project manager opens the meeting by going over the minutes of the last meeting , detailing the main points of each person's presentation . they do the prototype presentation which includes a model of the remote control . the group discusses this proposed model , approving of the small size and look of it . they goes over finances and are pleased to find that they are well within budget . however , while the marketing expert is doing the product evaulation the group realizes that they neglected to calculate voice recognition into the financing . their cost had been 8.20 euros and they have  4.30 left to cover it , so they decide to settle for whatever quality it will buy . they rate their product on its shape , size , color , feel , and functionality . they discuss the project process , talk briefly about adding more features , and one member suggests eliminating a mute buttons and include a diffferent feature . they are happy with the creativity , leadership , and teamwork within the group , and close the meeting by thanking one another . the remote is a snail shape with bright colors , blue and yellow with multi-colored buttons . compact in size . it includes a remote holder in the shape of a shell . the case will be made of plastic and the buttons of soft rubber . its features will include an on/off button , two mute buttons , nine channel buttons , two buttons for increasing/decreasing the volume , two buttons for scrolling up/down channels , a menu button in the center which controls the color/sharpness/brightness of the picture , and a swapping button . channel buttons numbered , rest of the buttons have symbols indicating function . light emitting diode is flourescent green . in their cost evaluation they got 8.20 , not factoring in the voice recognition feature . they decide to settle for the level of quality the remaining 4.30 euros will get them . the group spent 8.20 euros on their product , but they almost forgot to factor in voice recognition , which may cost more than the 4.30 euros remaining . they will have to settle for whatever level of quality that 4.30 euros can buy .

Reference Summary: the project manager stated the agenda and the marketing expert discussed what functions are most relevant on a remote , what the target demographic is , and what his vision for the appearance of the remote is . the marketing expert also brought up the idea to include a docking station to prevent the remote from getting lost and the idea to include an lcd screen . the user interface designer pushed for a user-friendly interface with large buttons , a display function , a touchscreen , and the capability of controlling different devices . the industrial designer discussed the interior workings of a remote and the project manager briefed the team on some new requirements they are to abide by . the team then discussed teletext , the target demographic , the buttons the remote should have , the idea of marketing a remote designed for the elderly , an audio signal which can sound if the remote is lost , lcd screens , and language options . the industrial designer will work on the components concept . the user interface designer will work on the user interface concept and trend-watching the remote will only be used for televisions . the user target group consists of adults age sixty to eighty . the corporate image must be visible in the design of the remote . the team will implement teletext in their design if it does not cost too much . the remote will only have a few buttons . the remote will have a docking station . the remote will have an audio signal to allow users to locate it when misplaced-the team will focus on creating a remote for elderly people . the remote will feature a small lcd screen . the remote will be fancy . the remote will be easy to learn . the remote will be made to accommodate different languages . cost of a touchscreen . whether to include teletext in the design despite the new requirement which indicates that the team is not to work with teletext . the user target group of adults age forty and up is quite small . what buttons and functions to include on the remote . whether to include a scroll button . whether to focus more on the layout of the buttons or the docking station .
Generated Summary: the marketing expert presented research on user requirements and user tendencies with remote controls . the research indicated that users between the ages of 16 and 45 want a fancier , more functional , easier-to-use remote , and tend to be critical of ugly or poorly designed remotes . he also indicated that younger users are interested in more advanced functions , while users between 46 and 55 don't tend to use many buttons . in order to meet the profit goals of the project , the team had to consider including a lock function and a menu that would if the remote should have a programmable "fa" function to access; it was decided that there would be only for the if it should be useful or not to use . after the project manager announced that they would have to work together on the technical functions . they discussed how to find a remote when misplaced and when lost . there will be no longer be a discussion about the cost of components and the remote but it is unlikely that they will be able to include many of the company colors and logo on the remote . this will be used only for televisions , so that it could be used with the company colours and logo , but not necessarily be incorporated into the design of the device . when it becomes evident from the manager's new requirements , they would be unable to find the location of their location when they get lost , or when they found the remote when it is misplace

Reference Summary: the project manager gave an introduction to the goal of the project , to create a trendy yet user-friendly remote . she presented a long-range agenda for the whole project . the group introduced themselves to each other and practiced with the meeting room tools by drawing on the board . the project manager presented the project budget , the projected price point , and the projected profit aim for the project . then the group began a discussion about their own experiences with remote controls to generate initial design ideas for making the product user-friendly . they discussed grouping features into a menu and adding an lcd display . they also discussed the look of various materials that may be used in the design , in keeping with the company's goal to create fashionable electronics . the group will prepare for the functional design meeting to discuss the components and functions of the product . there may not be enough money in the budget to allow the addition of all the features the group discussed , such as the lcd display .
Generated Summary: the project manager introduced the project to the group and gave an agenda for the project as a whole . the group practiced using the meeting-room equipment by drawing on the whiteboard and then discussed their initial ideas about the remote control they were to create . the project Manager then went over the project budget and defined the roles and tasks of the team members . the team then began to work on their individual presentations . the conceptual designer discussed the basic functions of a remote control and how they work together . he suggested that the team should create a remote that is original , trendy , appealing to a wide market , and user-friendly . the user interface designer presented several characteristics of a dog and discussed the three unique features that make a good remote control . the industrial designer presented the working design of the remote , which he suggested should resemble a bird . the marketing expert discussed user requirements and what functions the remote was required to have . he proposed including a locator function and a speech recognition feature . the interface specialist discussed the technical functions design and how to categorize the functions that will be included in the remote . the technical designer will work on the internal working design . the customer interface specialist will look at the user requirements specification . the manufacturing expert will research the needs and desires of users . the selling price of the device will be about twenty five euros each . the remote will be sold internationally . the production costs will be twelve euros and fifty cents . the remotes will be made of plastic and rubber

Reference Summary: the project manager gave an introduction to the goal of the project , to create a trendy yet user-friendly remote . she presented a long-range agenda for the whole project . the group introduced themselves to each other and practiced with the meeting room tools by drawing on the board . the project manager presented the project budget , the projected price point , and the projected profit aim for the project . then the group began a discussion about their own experiences with remote controls to generate initial design ideas for making the product user-friendly . they discussed grouping features into a menu and adding an lcd display . they also discussed the look of various materials that may be used in the design , in keeping with the company's goal to create fashionable electronics . the group will prepare for the functional design meeting to discuss the components and functions of the product . there may not be enough money in the budget to allow the addition of all the features the group discussed , such as the lcd display .
Generated Summary: the team members introduced themselves to each other by name and by their roles in the project . the project manager introduced the upcoming project to the team and then the team members participated in an exercise in which they drew their favorite animal and discussed why they liked the animal . the project manager talked about the project finances and the team engaged in a brainstorming session about various features to consider in producing a remote . the project manager then further discussed the roles of the team members . the industrial designer will work on the working design of the remote . the user interface designer will work on the technical functions of the remote . the marketing expert will work on user requirements specifications the remote will sell for 25 euro . the remote will be sold internationally . the production costs cannot exceed 12.50 euro . whether the remote will be used exclusively for televisions .

Reference Summary: the project manager gave an introduction to the goal of the project , to create a trendy yet user-friendly remote . she presented a long-range agenda for the whole project . the group introduced themselves to each other and practiced with the meeting room tools by drawing on the board . the project manager presented the project budget , the projected price point , and the projected profit aim for the project . then the group began a discussion about their own experiences with remote controls to generate initial design ideas for making the product user-friendly . they discussed grouping features into a menu and adding an lcd display . they also discussed the look of various materials that may be used in the design , in keeping with the company's goal to create fashionable electronics . the group will prepare for the functional design meeting to discuss the components and functions of the product . there may not be enough money in the budget to allow the addition of all the features the group discussed , such as the lcd display .
Generated Summary: the project manager introduced the upcoming project to the team and then the team members participated in an exercise in which they drew their favorite animal and discussed why they liked the animal . the project discussed the project finances and selling prices . the team then discussed their experiences with remotes and what features in terms of functionality and appearance they wanted to include in the remote they are to create . the industrial designer will work on the working design . the user interface designer will focus on technical functions . the marketing executive will work towards what requirements the remote has to fulfill the remote will sell for 25 euros . the production costs cannot exceed 12.50 euros . whether the mark-up reflected in the selling price is normal .

Reference Summary: the industrial designer gave his presentation on the basic functions of the remote . he presented the basic components that remotes share and suggested that smaller batteries be considered in the product design . the user interface designer presented his ideas for making the remote easy-to-use; he discussed using a simple design and hiding complicated features from the main interface . the marketing expert presented the findings from a lab study on user requirements for a remote control device , and discussed users' demand for a simple interface and advanced technology . the project manager presented the new requirements that the remote not include a teletext function , that it be used only to control television , and that it include the company image in its design . the group narrowed down their target marketing group to the youth market . they discussed the functions the remote will have , including video plus capability and rechargeable batteries . a customer service plan was suggested to make the remote seem more user-friendly , but it was decided that helpful manuals were more within the budget . the group then discussed the shell-like shape of the remote and including several different casing options to buyers . the marketing expert will research consumers' opinions on instruction manuals . it was decided that the group will produce one product design instead of creating alternate designs in an attempt to accomodate different users' preferences . the marketing will be focused towards a young , business-class buyer . the remote will feature video plus capabilities and a seashell-like shape to accomodate the lcd display and the flip screen . the remote will be bundled with a docking station to recharge the remote's batteries and a user-friendly instruction manual , and multiple casings will be made available . the limitations of the budget will restrict the development of some features; several of the features that the group wanted to include may have to be made simpler to decrease cost .
Generated Summary: the project manager recapped the decisions made in the previous meeting and two team members presented their prototype and discussed the features the prototype contained . the industrial designer presented the options for types of batteries , shapes for the remote , and materials to use in making the case . the user interface designer discussed how speech recognition could be used to create an interface for an ergonomic remote . the marketing expert presented feedback from users and users indicated that the prototype had met many of the initial goals . the team then discussed features to include in the remote such as an lcd screen , a jog dial , and speech recognition . the program manager said that he would ask to what extent the company logo had to be incorporated into the design in order to keep the price point of the device close to the original goal . the group decided to use triple a batteries in their design . the remote will be powered by a single battery . the case will be single-curved . there will be no display physically featured on the remote itself; instead the device will be designed to look like a flip-open book . a locator function will be included to help locate the remote when lost . speech recognition will be implemented by adding a small button to the side of the remote which will operate either through voice recognition or through paging . the target age group is people aged fifteen to thirty five . the power source will be a normal aa battery . size of the battery . whether to use a triple a battery . how to minimize the

Reference Summary: the industrial designer gave his presentation on the basic functions of the remote . he presented the basic components that remotes share and suggested that smaller batteries be considered in the product design . the user interface designer presented his ideas for making the remote easy-to-use; he discussed using a simple design and hiding complicated features from the main interface . the marketing expert presented the findings from a lab study on user requirements for a remote control device , and discussed users' demand for a simple interface and advanced technology . the project manager presented the new requirements that the remote not include a teletext function , that it be used only to control television , and that it include the company image in its design . the group narrowed down their target marketing group to the youth market . they discussed the functions the remote will have , including video plus capability and rechargeable batteries . a customer service plan was suggested to make the remote seem more user-friendly , but it was decided that helpful manuals were more within the budget . the group then discussed the shell-like shape of the remote and including several different casing options to buyers . the marketing expert will research consumers' opinions on instruction manuals . it was decided that the group will produce one product design instead of creating alternate designs in an attempt to accomodate different users' preferences . the marketing will be focused towards a young , business-class buyer . the remote will feature video plus capabilities and a seashell-like shape to accomodate the lcd display and the flip screen . the remote will be bundled with a docking station to recharge the remote's batteries and a user-friendly instruction manual , and multiple casings will be made available . the limitations of the budget will restrict the development of some features; several of the features that the group wanted to include may have to be made simpler to decrease cost .
Generated Summary: the project manager recapped the decisions made in the previous meeting . the industrial designer presented the working design that will appear in the prototype , and discussed the size and shape of the device . the user interface designer discussed what features the remote was required to have and presented two existing products which were based on different concepts . the marketing expert discussed his marketing strategy for the project and the group discussed several product features they could include in the design of the remote . the program manager asked the group about their target group . the group decided that the target group would be people aged fifteen to thirty five . the power source will be triple a alkaline batteries . the remote will have a flip-open design . the device will be small and easy to carry . the display will be black with a yellow glow-in-the-dark material . the corporate logo will be displayed on the remote , along with the slogan "America's Choice". the group had a discussion to decide on the features that will be incorporated into the design . they decided to include a battery charging stand , to use a special chip , and to not include a recharger with a locator function . the meeting was adjourned . the product will be sold for twenty five euros with a profit aim of fifty million euros . the company will not pay any attention to the product evaluation . the groups were satisfied with the prototype but felt it was too small and cumbersome to be fashionable . *na* the group would like to incorporate a recharging

Reference Summary: the industrial designer gave his presentation on the basic functions of the remote . he presented the basic components that remotes share and suggested that smaller batteries be considered in the product design . the user interface designer presented his ideas for making the remote easy-to-use; he discussed using a simple design and hiding complicated features from the main interface . the marketing expert presented the findings from a lab study on user requirements for a remote control device , and discussed users' demand for a simple interface and advanced technology . the project manager presented the new requirements that the remote not include a teletext function , that it be used only to control television , and that it include the company image in its design . the group narrowed down their target marketing group to the youth market . they discussed the functions the remote will have , including video plus capability and rechargeable batteries . a customer service plan was suggested to make the remote seem more user-friendly , but it was decided that helpful manuals were more within the budget . the group then discussed the shell-like shape of the remote and including several different casing options to buyers . the marketing expert will research consumers' opinions on instruction manuals . it was decided that the group will produce one product design instead of creating alternate designs in an attempt to accomodate different users' preferences . the marketing will be focused towards a young , business-class buyer . the remote will feature video plus capabilities and a seashell-like shape to accomodate the lcd display and the flip screen . the remote will be bundled with a docking station to recharge the remote's batteries and a user-friendly instruction manual , and multiple casings will be made available . the limitations of the budget will restrict the development of some features; several of the features that the group wanted to include may have to be made simpler to decrease cost .
Generated Summary: the project manager recapped the decisions made in the previous meeting and briefed the team on some new requirements to abide by when designing the remote . the user interface designer presented two existing products and discussed what features the team should retain in order to maintain their target demographic . the marketing expert discussed the results of trend-watching reports and the team discussed the following features in terms of appearance and functionality: universal capability , one remote for all devices , and a touch-screen interface . the industrial designer discussed the interior workings of a remote and the team discussed the option to include a charging stand with the remote . the team then discussed what components , materials , and energy sources to use . the industrial designer will work on the look and feel of the design . the user interface designer will work on the user interface design . the marketing expert will work on the product evaluation the remote will use triple batteries . the remote will not feature a touch screen interface . the remote will use conventional batteries . the corporate image must be recognizable in the design of the remote . the remote will have a square shape . the remote will not feature a charging stand . the remote will use an advanced chip-on-print . cost of components . whether to include a charging stand with the remote . whether to include a scroll wheel for the remote . whether to have a touch screen interface . whether to
