Reference Summary: the industrial designer gave his presentation on the basic functions of the remote . he presented the basic components that remotes share and suggested that smaller batteries be considered in the product design . the user interface designer presented his ideas for making the remote easy-to-use; he discussed using a simple design and hiding complicated features from the main interface . the marketing expert presented the findings from a lab study on user requirements for a remote control device , and discussed users' demand for a simple interface and advanced technology . the project manager presented the new requirements that the remote not include a teletext function , that it be used only to control television , and that it include the company image in its design . the group narrowed down their target marketing group to the youth market . they discussed the functions the remote will have , including video plus capability and rechargeable batteries . a customer service plan was suggested to make the remote seem more user-friendly , but it was decided that helpful manuals were more within the budget . the group then discussed the shell-like shape of the remote and including several different casing options to buyers . the marketing expert will research consumers' opinions on instruction manuals . it was decided that the group will produce one product design instead of creating alternate designs in an attempt to accomodate different users' preferences . the marketing will be focused towards a young , business-class buyer . the remote will feature video plus capabilities and a seashell-like shape to accomodate the lcd display and the flip screen . the remote will be bundled with a docking station to recharge the remote's batteries and a user-friendly instruction manual , and multiple casings will be made available . the limitations of the budget will restrict the development of some features; several of the features that the group wanted to include may have to be made simpler to decrease cost .
Generated Summary: the project manager recapped the decisions made in the previous meeting and briefed the team on some new requirements to abide by in designing the remote . the user interface designer presented two existing remote controls on the market and discussed what features the team should integrate into the design of the remote . the marketing expert discussed the results of trend watching reports which indicated a need for products which have a fruit and vegetable theme , are easy to use , are technologically innovative , are not flashy , have a fruit and vegetable theme , and are not targeted towards the elderly . the industrial designer presented options for batteries which would keep the remote powered all the time . the team then discussed how to incorporate a fruit and vegetable theme into the design of the remote . the industrial designer will work on the look and feel of the design . the user interface designer will work on the user interface design . the marketing expert will work on the product evaluation the remote will not contain a talk-back function . the remote will have an lcd screen . the remote will have a jog dial . the remote will have a power button . whether to include a talk-back function in the design of the remote . how to incorporate a fruit and vegetable theme into the design of the remote . whether to include a jog dial in the design of the remote .

Reference Summary: the industrial designer gave his presentation on the basic functions of the remote . he presented the basic components that remotes share and suggested that smaller batteries be considered in the product design . the user interface designer presented his ideas for making the remote easy-to-use; he discussed using a simple design and hiding complicated features from the main interface . the marketing expert presented the findings from a lab study on user requirements for a remote control device , and discussed users' demand for a simple interface and advanced technology . the project manager presented the new requirements that the remote not include a teletext function , that it be used only to control television , and that it include the company image in its design . the group narrowed down their target marketing group to the youth market . they discussed the functions the remote will have , including video plus capability and rechargeable batteries . a customer service plan was suggested to make the remote seem more user-friendly , but it was decided that helpful manuals were more within the budget . the group then discussed the shell-like shape of the remote and including several different casing options to buyers . the marketing expert will research consumers' opinions on instruction manuals . it was decided that the group will produce one product design instead of creating alternate designs in an attempt to accomodate different users' preferences . the marketing will be focused towards a young , business-class buyer . the remote will feature video plus capabilities and a seashell-like shape to accomodate the lcd display and the flip screen . the remote will be bundled with a docking station to recharge the remote's batteries and a user-friendly instruction manual , and multiple casings will be made available . the limitations of the budget will restrict the development of some features; several of the features that the group wanted to include may have to be made simpler to decrease cost .
Generated Summary: the project manager reviewed the decisions made in the previous meeting . the industrial designer presented the working design of the remote and discussed various options for batteries . he discussed using infrared , flip-open design , and adding an electronic panel for further features . she also discussed using a circular battery to reduce the size of the control , as well as reducing the power consumption of the device . they discussed including an lcd screen for easier reading of the menus on the remote , a programmable remote and incorporating a screen for programming options . there was a discussion of the project budget , the marketing expert discussed trends in the industry , trend watching the company image in the product , fashion in the company logo , accessibility , age range , reflecting the company's image , aesthetic appeal to young and to older consumers .

Reference Summary: the industrial designer gave his presentation on the basic functions of the remote . he presented the basic components that remotes share and suggested that smaller batteries be considered in the product design . the user interface designer presented his ideas for making the remote easy-to-use; he discussed using a simple design and hiding complicated features from the main interface . the marketing expert presented the findings from a lab study on user requirements for a remote control device , and discussed users' demand for a simple interface and advanced technology . the project manager presented the new requirements that the remote not include a teletext function , that it be used only to control television , and that it include the company image in its design . the group narrowed down their target marketing group to the youth market . they discussed the functions the remote will have , including video plus capability and rechargeable batteries . a customer service plan was suggested to make the remote seem more user-friendly , but it was decided that helpful manuals were more within the budget . the group then discussed the shell-like shape of the remote and including several different casing options to buyers . the marketing expert will research consumers' opinions on instruction manuals . it was decided that the group will produce one product design instead of creating alternate designs in an attempt to accomodate different users' preferences . the marketing will be focused towards a young , business-class buyer . the remote will feature video plus capabilities and a seashell-like shape to accomodate the lcd display and the flip screen . the remote will be bundled with a docking station to recharge the remote's batteries and a user-friendly instruction manual , and multiple casings will be made available . the limitations of the budget will restrict the development of some features; several of the features that the group wanted to include may have to be made simpler to decrease cost .
Generated Summary: the marketing expert presented an analysis of existing remote controls to help decide what features to include in the prototype . the industrial designer presented options for reducing the size of the device and included information about the types of batteries commonly used . he discussed using an lcd screen to simplify the interface on the remote , and discussed using a flip-open design for easier use with the group. the user interface designer discussed the interior workings of a remote and the options for adding features such as voice recognition , a menu for changing channel , or a lock button to access the menu on the television . this led to a discussion on the group's decision to include a scroll wheel for changing channels and volume settings . they discussed using triple a d screen for the remote and having a large capacity for the main interface , to use a circular battery for power source and using rechargeable battery type of battery to help keep the cost of components . after the project manager's closing , the group discussed their budget and working design , which had to wait for two more information . then the industrial specialist was instructed to prepare a prototype evaluation .

Reference Summary: the project manager opens the meeting by going over the minutes of the last meeting . the interface specialist begins her presentation by highlighting important remote functions and showing examples of remote interfaces . the group comments on her presentation , and then the industrial designer begins presenting . she talks about the technical electronic components of the remote , explains how a remote works , and shows a few pictures revealing the insides of a normal remote control . she suggests giving the remote a strong shell so it is durable , using a rechargable battery , and not adding a scroll wheel because it requires a sophisticated chip . the marketing expert presents , talking about user preferences for a small , simple , eye-catching , cute , appealing , and functional remote . fruit and vegetable shapes are popular this year , so a soft , spongy remote perhaps covered with cloth could make the item marketable . the group discusses the issues surrounding speech recognition , noting that if it is good quality it could be costly . they about the power source and review the objectives of the product . the project manager closes the meeting by telling each member what task she is to complete . the marketing expert will do the product evaluation . the industrial designer and interface specialist will work together on a prototype using modeling clay . the industrial designer will come up with a user interface design . their coaches will send specific instructions and answer questions . they decided that the product should be bright , colorful , trendy in design , strong , compact , have push buttons , and contain supplement features (possibly mute button , swapping button , voice recognition). the power source will be batteries because it is cost-effective . they will have the industrial engineer do more research on the cost of voice recognition before deciding whether to include that function . the group would like to include voice recognition as a feature , but they are not sure about how much it would cost . this will require further research by the industrial engineer .
Generated Summary: the project manager opened the meeting and went over the minutes of the previous meeting . the interface designer discussed the basic functions of a remote and suggested that a remote should have an on-off button , a switch to next channel , volume switch , mute and a number of buttons for changing channels . the marketing expert discussed the features that would make a desirable remote . she suggested that the remote should be small , be easy to use and not include too many buttons . the industrial designer presented options for energy sources , chips , case shapes and buttons , and programming options . the user interface designer then discussed voice recognition with the group . the group decided to use an infra-red chip to power the device . the remote will have a nine channel switch , and will feature a beeping noise when a user is trying to switch between channels . there will also be a small number pad for the remote which users can use to program their favorite programs . the programmable "favorites" button will be included on the remote . the size of the device will be 12.5 mm . the buttons will be normal colored , with one for volume control and another for channel selection . the display will be made of plastic with rubber grips . to add more features , the group discussed using rechargeable batteries , an rechargable stand , and a locator function . na .

Reference Summary: the project manager opens the meeting by going over the minutes of the last meeting . the interface specialist begins her presentation by highlighting important remote functions and showing examples of remote interfaces . the group comments on her presentation , and then the industrial designer begins presenting . she talks about the technical electronic components of the remote , explains how a remote works , and shows a few pictures revealing the insides of a normal remote control . she suggests giving the remote a strong shell so it is durable , using a rechargable battery , and not adding a scroll wheel because it requires a sophisticated chip . the marketing expert presents , talking about user preferences for a small , simple , eye-catching , cute , appealing , and functional remote . fruit and vegetable shapes are popular this year , so a soft , spongy remote perhaps covered with cloth could make the item marketable . the group discusses the issues surrounding speech recognition , noting that if it is good quality it could be costly . they about the power source and review the objectives of the product . the project manager closes the meeting by telling each member what task she is to complete . the marketing expert will do the product evaluation . the industrial designer and interface specialist will work together on a prototype using modeling clay . the industrial designer will come up with a user interface design . their coaches will send specific instructions and answer questions . they decided that the product should be bright , colorful , trendy in design , strong , compact , have push buttons , and contain supplement features (possibly mute button , swapping button , voice recognition). the power source will be batteries because it is cost-effective . they will have the industrial engineer do more research on the cost of voice recognition before deciding whether to include that function . the group would like to include voice recognition as a feature , but they are not sure about how much it would cost . this will require further research by the industrial engineer .
Generated Summary: the user interface designer and the industrial designer met to review the minutes of the previous meeting . the marketing expert presented her method of working and discussed the marketing goals for the project . she suggested that the remote should be something that people find very easy to use and should include a short learning curve . the marketing expert also suggested that the remote could feature an lcd screen , an on/off switch , a timer , and a feature to prevent children from getting lost while using the remote . the industrial designer discussed the interior workings of a remote and the restrictions involved in combining various components . the project manager then led the team in a discussion on what features a good remote has . the team then discussed whether to include an lcd screen , a timer , and a feature to prevent children from getting lost while using the remote . the industrial designer will work on the components concept . the user interface designer will work on the user interface design . the marketing expert will work on the product evaluation the remote will only be used for televisions . the corporate image must be recognizable in the product . the remote will have an on/off switch . whether to include an lcd screen . whether to include an on/off switch . whether to have a timer .

Reference Summary: the project manager opens the meeting by going over the minutes of the last meeting . the interface specialist begins her presentation by highlighting important remote functions and showing examples of remote interfaces . the group comments on her presentation , and then the industrial designer begins presenting . she talks about the technical electronic components of the remote , explains how a remote works , and shows a few pictures revealing the insides of a normal remote control . she suggests giving the remote a strong shell so it is durable , using a rechargable battery , and not adding a scroll wheel because it requires a sophisticated chip . the marketing expert presents , talking about user preferences for a small , simple , eye-catching , cute , appealing , and functional remote . fruit and vegetable shapes are popular this year , so a soft , spongy remote perhaps covered with cloth could make the item marketable . the group discusses the issues surrounding speech recognition , noting that if it is good quality it could be costly . they about the power source and review the objectives of the product . the project manager closes the meeting by telling each member what task she is to complete . the marketing expert will do the product evaluation . the industrial designer and interface specialist will work together on a prototype using modeling clay . the industrial designer will come up with a user interface design . their coaches will send specific instructions and answer questions . they decided that the product should be bright , colorful , trendy in design , strong , compact , have push buttons , and contain supplement features (possibly mute button , swapping button , voice recognition). the power source will be batteries because it is cost-effective . they will have the industrial engineer do more research on the cost of voice recognition before deciding whether to include that function . the group would like to include voice recognition as a feature , but they are not sure about how much it would cost . this will require further research by the industrial engineer .
Generated Summary: the user interface designer and the industrial designer presented their initial ideas about the appearance and functions of the device . they suggested that a remote should be small and simple to use and should include an on/off switch , an infra-red component , and a feature to help prevent the loss of a remote . they also discussed what type of chip , medium or large , should be used . the marketing expert then led the team in conducting a product evaluation of several competitors' remotes . the evaluation showed that most of the competitors' remotes were easy to use and fairly spongy , and that the average user complaint was that their remote was difficult to use . the team then discussed what features in terms of appearance and functionality to include in the remote . the industrial designer will work on the components concept . the user interface designer will work on the user interface . the marketing expert will work on the product evaluation the remote will only be used for televisions . the corporate image must be recognizable in the product . the remote will have an on/off switch and will feature an on/off switch . the remote will have a swappable channel . the number buttons will be on/off . the remote will have an an anar . whether to include a feature to help prevent the loss of a remote . whether to include a feature to help prevent the loss of a remote . whether to have a casing that is small

Reference Summary: the project manager opens the meeting by going over the minutes of the last meeting . the interface specialist begins her presentation by highlighting important remote functions and showing examples of remote interfaces . the group comments on her presentation , and then the industrial designer begins presenting . she talks about the technical electronic components of the remote , explains how a remote works , and shows a few pictures revealing the insides of a normal remote control . she suggests giving the remote a strong shell so it is durable , using a rechargable battery , and not adding a scroll wheel because it requires a sophisticated chip . the marketing expert presents , talking about user preferences for a small , simple , eye-catching , cute , appealing , and functional remote . fruit and vegetable shapes are popular this year , so a soft , spongy remote perhaps covered with cloth could make the item marketable . the group discusses the issues surrounding speech recognition , noting that if it is good quality it could be costly . they about the power source and review the objectives of the product . the project manager closes the meeting by telling each member what task she is to complete . the marketing expert will do the product evaluation . the industrial designer and interface specialist will work together on a prototype using modeling clay . the industrial designer will come up with a user interface design . their coaches will send specific instructions and answer questions . they decided that the product should be bright , colorful , trendy in design , strong , compact , have push buttons , and contain supplement features (possibly mute button , swapping button , voice recognition). the power source will be batteries because it is cost-effective . they will have the industrial engineer do more research on the cost of voice recognition before deciding whether to include that function . the group would like to include voice recognition as a feature , but they are not sure about how much it would cost . this will require further research by the industrial engineer .
Generated Summary: the project manager reviewed the minutes of the previous meeting . the user interface designer discussed the interface of a remote with the group . she suggested that the remote should have an on-off button , a channel lock , an anar alarm , and be shaped like a t-shirt . it should also have an electri-electrici feature , as well as a timer so that users can program their favorite programs from the remote . there should also be nine channel switches , swapping buttons by pressing one

Reference Summary: the project manager opens the meeting by going over the minutes of the last meeting , detailing the main points of each person's presentation . they do the prototype presentation which includes a model of the remote control . the group discusses this proposed model , approving of the small size and look of it . they goes over finances and are pleased to find that they are well within budget . however , while the marketing expert is doing the product evaulation the group realizes that they neglected to calculate voice recognition into the financing . their cost had been 8.20 euros and they have  4.30 left to cover it , so they decide to settle for whatever quality it will buy . they rate their product on its shape , size , color , feel , and functionality . they discuss the project process , talk briefly about adding more features , and one member suggests eliminating a mute buttons and include a diffferent feature . they are happy with the creativity , leadership , and teamwork within the group , and close the meeting by thanking one another . the remote is a snail shape with bright colors , blue and yellow with multi-colored buttons . compact in size . it includes a remote holder in the shape of a shell . the case will be made of plastic and the buttons of soft rubber . its features will include an on/off button , two mute buttons , nine channel buttons , two buttons for increasing/decreasing the volume , two buttons for scrolling up/down channels , a menu button in the center which controls the color/sharpness/brightness of the picture , and a swapping button . channel buttons numbered , rest of the buttons have symbols indicating function . light emitting diode is flourescent green . in their cost evaluation they got 8.20 , not factoring in the voice recognition feature . they decide to settle for the level of quality the remaining 4.30 euros will get them . the group spent 8.20 euros on their product , but they almost forgot to factor in voice recognition , which may cost more than the 4.30 euros remaining . they will have to settle for whatever level of quality that 4.30 euros can buy .

Reference Summary: the project manager opens the meeting by going over the minutes of the last meeting , detailing the main points of each person's presentation . they do the prototype presentation which includes a model of the remote control . the group discusses this proposed model , approving of the small size and look of it . they goes over finances and are pleased to find that they are well within budget . however , while the marketing expert is doing the product evaulation the group realizes that they neglected to calculate voice recognition into the financing . their cost had been 8.20 euros and they have  4.30 left to cover it , so they decide to settle for whatever quality it will buy . they rate their product on its shape , size , color , feel , and functionality . they discuss the project process , talk briefly about adding more features , and one member suggests eliminating a mute buttons and include a diffferent feature . they are happy with the creativity , leadership , and teamwork within the group , and close the meeting by thanking one another . the remote is a snail shape with bright colors , blue and yellow with multi-colored buttons . compact in size . it includes a remote holder in the shape of a shell . the case will be made of plastic and the buttons of soft rubber . its features will include an on/off button , two mute buttons , nine channel buttons , two buttons for increasing/decreasing the volume , two buttons for scrolling up/down channels , a menu button in the center which controls the color/sharpness/brightness of the picture , and a swapping button . channel buttons numbered , rest of the buttons have symbols indicating function . light emitting diode is flourescent green . in their cost evaluation they got 8.20 , not factoring in the voice recognition feature . they decide to settle for the level of quality the remaining 4.30 euros will get them . the group spent 8.20 euros on their product , but they almost forgot to factor in voice recognition , which may cost more than the 4.30 euros remaining . they will have to settle for whatever level of quality that 4.30 euros can buy .

Reference Summary: the project manager went over the agenda . the industrial designer gave a presentation about the options for power source , materials and components . he recommended using kinetic energy , and having a double-curved rubber case . the group decided to combine batteries and kinetic energy . the marketing expert reported on current trends among young people for fresh fruity colours and spongy material . he explained that the remote should look fancy , and be technologically innovative and easy to use . he suggested using removable customisable covers , speech recognition , installing some games into the remote , and implementing a parental control feature . the user interface designer talked about having a simple layout with not many buttons . most features will be controlled through the menu . the group discussed the various options and decided to use games but not speech recognition . after a lot of discussion they decided to implement a simple parental control feature . the project manager talked about what he had learned at a masterclass on knowledge management . the group discussed how to incorporate the company logo and motto onto the remote , including having an animated logo on the touch screen . the project manager gave the group instructions about what to do before the next meeting . the industrial designer and user interface designer will work together on a prototype , using the smartboard . the marketing expert will work on the product evaluation . the energy source will be a combination of batteries and kinetic energy . the case will be double-curved and made of rubber , with fruity-coloured removable covers . there will be a touch screen and not many buttons . the remote will include games and a simple parental control feature . it will not use speech recognition . the user interface designer had problems with his laptop while he was preparing his presentation . the group were unsure about how to implement a parental control feature , or if it would be worth the time and money .
Generated Summary: the marketing expert and industrial designer presented their prototype to the group and discussed the options for energy sources , materials , and components . the project manager reviewed the minutes from the previous meeting . the group decided to use solar power to power the device . the user interface designer presented two existing products on the market - a voice recognition remote and a children's remote - and discussed what features in terms of appearance and functionality to include in the remote the group is designing . the remote will not feature an lcd screen . it will be curved and shaped like a teletubbie . there will be no display physically featured on the remote itself; instead the buttons will be on the inside of the remote . to incorporate the company logo , the logo will be displayed through the buttons . the device will use a kinetic battery . the solar power source was discussed , along with other options such as rechargeable internal batteries or a stand . the prototype was evaluated on the basis of its look and feel , technological innovation , ease of use , and its ability to be misplaced . overall , the prototype performed quite well. the group were satisfied with the prototype . however , they were unsatisfied with the lack of information about the cost of components . they did not know how much the battery would cost . they also had difficulties setting up their computers and using the meeting-room equipment .

Reference Summary: the project manager went over the agenda . the industrial designer gave a presentation about the options for power source , materials and components . he recommended using kinetic energy , and having a double-curved rubber case . the group decided to combine batteries and kinetic energy . the marketing expert reported on current trends among young people for fresh fruity colours and spongy material . he explained that the remote should look fancy , and be technologically innovative and easy to use . he suggested using removable customisable covers , speech recognition , installing some games into the remote , and implementing a parental control feature . the user interface designer talked about having a simple layout with not many buttons . most features will be controlled through the menu . the group discussed the various options and decided to use games but not speech recognition . after a lot of discussion they decided to implement a simple parental control feature . the project manager talked about what he had learned at a masterclass on knowledge management . the group discussed how to incorporate the company logo and motto onto the remote , including having an animated logo on the touch screen . the project manager gave the group instructions about what to do before the next meeting . the industrial designer and user interface designer will work together on a prototype , using the smartboard . the marketing expert will work on the product evaluation . the energy source will be a combination of batteries and kinetic energy . the case will be double-curved and made of rubber , with fruity-coloured removable covers . there will be a touch screen and not many buttons . the remote will include games and a simple parental control feature . it will not use speech recognition . the user interface designer had problems with his laptop while he was preparing his presentation . the group were unsure about how to implement a parental control feature , or if it would be worth the time and money .
Generated Summary: the project manager opened the meeting and introduced the upcoming project . the marketing expert gave an evaluation of user requirements and led the team in a discussion in which the team discussed their target group and made decisions on the components and energy sources to use in their design . the industrial designer discussed the options for energy sources and materials to use for the case and buttons . the user interface designer presented his concept for the remote which he called the "millennium remote control". the group discussed what buttons would be needed to operate the device . he suggested using a scroll wheel on the side of the remote to switch between two channels . the group then discussed the option to use a solar panel or kinetic battery . the research into user requirements showed that younger people like straightforward shapes and colors . they also like sports and video games . however , they do not like large expanses of colored rubber . the team decided to use some kind of rubber to give the device style . the corporate logo should be recognizable on the remote . the remote will have a scroll button . the device will use solar power . the energy source will be combined with kinetic energy . the case will be made of a soft , spongy material . large buttons will be included for the main functions such as on/off , channel up/down browsing , volume and program selection , and for the teletext buttons . having a remote that operates either through voice recognition or through paging . what type of battery to use .

Reference Summary: the project manager went over the agenda . the industrial designer gave a presentation about the options for power source , materials and components . he recommended using kinetic energy , and having a double-curved rubber case . the group decided to combine batteries and kinetic energy . the marketing expert reported on current trends among young people for fresh fruity colours and spongy material . he explained that the remote should look fancy , and be technologically innovative and easy to use . he suggested using removable customisable covers , speech recognition , installing some games into the remote , and implementing a parental control feature . the user interface designer talked about having a simple layout with not many buttons . most features will be controlled through the menu . the group discussed the various options and decided to use games but not speech recognition . after a lot of discussion they decided to implement a simple parental control feature . the project manager talked about what he had learned at a masterclass on knowledge management . the group discussed how to incorporate the company logo and motto onto the remote , including having an animated logo on the touch screen . the project manager gave the group instructions about what to do before the next meeting . the industrial designer and user interface designer will work together on a prototype , using the smartboard . the marketing expert will work on the product evaluation . the energy source will be a combination of batteries and kinetic energy . the case will be double-curved and made of rubber , with fruity-coloured removable covers . there will be a touch screen and not many buttons . the remote will include games and a simple parental control feature . it will not use speech recognition . the user interface designer had problems with his laptop while he was preparing his presentation . the group were unsure about how to implement a parental control feature , or if it would be worth the time and money .
Generated Summary: the project manager opened the meeting and had the team members present their concepts for the remote control . the industrial designer presented two options for batteries and discussed how to make the remote more user-friendly . he also discussed the type of material to use and the number of buttons to include . after the marketing expert presented , the user interface designer discussed the problem with his laptop , and the team discussed what features to include in the remote such as a touch-screen interface , traditional materials , a kinetic battery and a rotating case for the case to rechargeable batteries . they discussed the possibility of using a battery powered remote with a rechargeable battery and decided to use a standard battery instead of a remote that charges itself by shaking a power source such as lithium battery . there was a discussion of the team's decision on the energy source and the possibility to use an recharging stand-powered remote that is powered by kinetic energy . when the remote gets low , it is energized , but it is not possible to include an programmable stand . it was decided that the remote should feature a scroll wheel , so that it could be used for a laptop

Reference Summary: the project manager went over the agenda . the industrial designer gave a presentation about the options for power source , materials and components . he recommended using kinetic energy , and having a double-curved rubber case . the group decided to combine batteries and kinetic energy . the marketing expert reported on current trends among young people for fresh fruity colours and spongy material . he explained that the remote should look fancy , and be technologically innovative and easy to use . he suggested using removable customisable covers , speech recognition , installing some games into the remote , and implementing a parental control feature . the user interface designer talked about having a simple layout with not many buttons . most features will be controlled through the menu . the group discussed the various options and decided to use games but not speech recognition . after a lot of discussion they decided to implement a simple parental control feature . the project manager talked about what he had learned at a masterclass on knowledge management . the group discussed how to incorporate the company logo and motto onto the remote , including having an animated logo on the touch screen . the project manager gave the group instructions about what to do before the next meeting . the industrial designer and user interface designer will work together on a prototype , using the smartboard . the marketing expert will work on the product evaluation . the energy source will be a combination of batteries and kinetic energy . the case will be double-curved and made of rubber , with fruity-coloured removable covers . there will be a touch screen and not many buttons . the remote will include games and a simple parental control feature . it will not use speech recognition . the user interface designer had problems with his laptop while he was preparing his presentation . the group were unsure about how to implement a parental control feature , or if it would be worth the time and money .
Generated Summary: the project manager opened the meeting and had the industrial designer and user interface designer present their conceptual designs for the remote control . the marketing expert discussed the target group for the remote: young people between the ages of twelve and thirty-five . the industrial designer discussed the options for batteries , shapes and materials to use for the case , and features to include such as a lock function , scroll wheels for controlling multiple devices , and lcd screens for controlling televisions and gaming consoles . the user interface designer presented two existing remote control designs to the group , showing how they differed in appearance , functionality , and usability . the marketing expert then led the group in a brainstorming session about features to include in the remote control design . the group decided on what materials and shapes to use , how many buttons to have , and the color of the remote . the industrial designer and user interface designer will work on a prototype evaluation . the marketing expert will work on a prototype evaluation . the industrial designer and user interface designer worked together on a drawing of the remote control prototype . the industrial designer and user interface designer will work on a prototype evaluation . the marketing expert will work on a prototype evaluation . the remote will have a locking function . the remote will have a scroll wheel for controlling multiple devices . the lcd screen will be covered in a soft material . the remote will have a locking function . the remote will have a recharging stand . the case will be made of rubber . the remote will have a locking function

Reference Summary: the project manager went over the agenda . the industrial designer gave a presentation about the options for power source , materials and components . he recommended using kinetic energy , and having a double-curved rubber case . the group decided to combine batteries and kinetic energy . the marketing expert reported on current trends among young people for fresh fruity colours and spongy material . he explained that the remote should look fancy , and be technologically innovative and easy to use . he suggested using removable customisable covers , speech recognition , installing some games into the remote , and implementing a parental control feature . the user interface designer talked about having a simple layout with not many buttons . most features will be controlled through the menu . the group discussed the various options and decided to use games but not speech recognition . after a lot of discussion they decided to implement a simple parental control feature . the project manager talked about what he had learned at a masterclass on knowledge management . the group discussed how to incorporate the company logo and motto onto the remote , including having an animated logo on the touch screen . the project manager gave the group instructions about what to do before the next meeting . the industrial designer and user interface designer will work together on a prototype , using the smartboard . the marketing expert will work on the product evaluation . the energy source will be a combination of batteries and kinetic energy . the case will be double-curved and made of rubber , with fruity-coloured removable covers . there will be a touch screen and not many buttons . the remote will include games and a simple parental control feature . it will not use speech recognition . the user interface designer had problems with his laptop while he was preparing his presentation . the group were unsure about how to implement a parental control feature , or if it would be worth the time and money .

Reference Summary: the project manager went over the agenda . the industrial designer gave a presentation about the options for power source , materials and components . he recommended using kinetic energy , and having a double-curved rubber case . the group decided to combine batteries and kinetic energy . the marketing expert reported on current trends among young people for fresh fruity colours and spongy material . he explained that the remote should look fancy , and be technologically innovative and easy to use . he suggested using removable customisable covers , speech recognition , installing some games into the remote , and implementing a parental control feature . the user interface designer talked about having a simple layout with not many buttons . most features will be controlled through the menu . the group discussed the various options and decided to use games but not speech recognition . after a lot of discussion they decided to implement a simple parental control feature . the project manager talked about what he had learned at a masterclass on knowledge management . the group discussed how to incorporate the company logo and motto onto the remote , including having an animated logo on the touch screen . the project manager gave the group instructions about what to do before the next meeting . the industrial designer and user interface designer will work together on a prototype , using the smartboard . the marketing expert will work on the product evaluation . the energy source will be a combination of batteries and kinetic energy . the case will be double-curved and made of rubber , with fruity-coloured removable covers . there will be a touch screen and not many buttons . the remote will include games and a simple parental control feature . it will not use speech recognition . the user interface designer had problems with his laptop while he was preparing his presentation . the group were unsure about how to implement a parental control feature , or if it would be worth the time and money .
Generated Summary: the user interface designer and the industrial designer had a discussion at length about components and the interface design . the marketing expert presented feedback from a master class on the preferences of two target groups - seniors and young people . they discussed the types of batteries and materials that would be suitable for a remote and discussed the type of case to use for the remote , as well as the buttons and features that would make the device easier to use and to maintain its appearance . after the discussion of the options for batteries , the group discussed what type of buttons would be needed to use , and what kind of casing the device should look like . it was decided that the remote should use a kinetic battery or a rechargeable battery . there was also a problem with the laptop , which caused the remote to not have a scroll wheel , but it was unnecessary and therefore a functional device . all participants will fill out a questionnaire at the next meeting .the group discussed how to make the remote more ergonomically-based on comfort , technologically innovative and aesthetic appeal to both men and women and men . also decided to use an ergonomic design , with a focus on simplicity and technological innovation in order to keep pace with the latest in mind-filled with ease of use .

Reference Summary: the project manager opened the meeting and went over the agenda . the user interface designer and the industrial designer presented their prototype design , describing the shape and layout of the remote . the group discussed colour options and decided to make the standard remote in fruity colours , but with the option of buying different exchangeable covers which might appeal more to older buyers . the marketing expert led the prototype evaluation and the group were happy with their product . the group calculated the production costs . the group were 4 euros over budget , so they decided to make the case single-curved and not to use kinetic energy . the project manager led the evaluation of the project process . the group felt that only the industrial designer and the user interface designer were able to be creative and work as a team . it was felt that the first meeting was disorganised because of poor leadership but the leadership improved in the later meetings . the group were also had problems with the digital pens . the group helped the project manager fill in the final report before the close of the meeting . the project manager will finish the final report . the remote will come in fruity colours as standard with the option of buying different exchangeable covers . the case will be single-curved instead of double-curved . the remote will be battery powered and will no longer use kinetic energy . the production costs were 4 euros over budget . which features should be changed to reduce production costs . there were not enough opportunities for creativity and teamwork . the digital pens did not work very well .

Reference Summary: the project manager opened the meeting and went over the agenda . the user interface designer and the industrial designer presented their prototype design , describing the shape and layout of the remote . the group discussed colour options and decided to make the standard remote in fruity colours , but with the option of buying different exchangeable covers which might appeal more to older buyers . the marketing expert led the prototype evaluation and the group were happy with their product . the group calculated the production costs . the group were 4 euros over budget , so they decided to make the case single-curved and not to use kinetic energy . the project manager led the evaluation of the project process . the group felt that only the industrial designer and the user interface designer were able to be creative and work as a team . it was felt that the first meeting was disorganised because of poor leadership but the leadership improved in the later meetings . the group were also had problems with the digital pens . the group helped the project manager fill in the final report before the close of the meeting . the project manager will finish the final report . the remote will come in fruity colours as standard with the option of buying different exchangeable covers . the case will be single-curved instead of double-curved . the remote will be battery powered and will no longer use kinetic energy . the production costs were 4 euros over budget . which features should be changed to reduce production costs . there were not enough opportunities for creativity and teamwork . the digital pens did not work very well .
Generated Summary: the project manager opened the meeting and then the user interface designer and industrial designer presented their prototype for the remote . the first prototype featured a single touch-screen device , with a locator function . the second prototype was shaped like a banana with children users in mind . the marketing expert gave the group an evaluation of the prototype . the group discussed the production costs of the remote; the total cost came to 12.50 euro , although this did not include the cost of the recharger , which was not on the price list). the group then discussed their experience on the project . they felt they worked well together and were creative , and they discussed using the smartboard as their tool . they also had problems using the meeting-room equipment . they were satisfied with the increased budget but felt constrained by the lack of time . they had problems with their laptops and did not have internet access at the time of the meeting .

Reference Summary: the project manager opened the meeting and went over the agenda . the user interface designer and the industrial designer presented their prototype design , describing the shape and layout of the remote . the group discussed colour options and decided to make the standard remote in fruity colours , but with the option of buying different exchangeable covers which might appeal more to older buyers . the marketing expert led the prototype evaluation and the group were happy with their product . the group calculated the production costs . the group were 4 euros over budget , so they decided to make the case single-curved and not to use kinetic energy . the project manager led the evaluation of the project process . the group felt that only the industrial designer and the user interface designer were able to be creative and work as a team . it was felt that the first meeting was disorganised because of poor leadership but the leadership improved in the later meetings . the group were also had problems with the digital pens . the group helped the project manager fill in the final report before the close of the meeting . the project manager will finish the final report . the remote will come in fruity colours as standard with the option of buying different exchangeable covers . the case will be single-curved instead of double-curved . the remote will be battery powered and will no longer use kinetic energy . the production costs were 4 euros over budget . which features should be changed to reduce production costs . there were not enough opportunities for creativity and teamwork . the digital pens did not work very well .
Generated Summary: the project manager introduced the upcoming project to the group and then the user interface designer and industrial designer presented a prototype of the remote which featured a single touch screen . the group discussed their initial ideas about the design and the shape of the device . they discussed making the remote easier to hold in one hand , artistic in appearance , and easy to use with the other hand . after the prototype presentation the group conducted an evaluation of the project process , finding that the project cost exceeded the budget by 12 and a half euros . it was decided to use a curved case and that the remote would not feature a smartboard . there was also a discussion about whether the remote should have a touch screen or lcd screen and whether it would be spongy or not curved or flat . na .

Reference Summary: the project manager opened the meeting and went over the agenda . the user interface designer and the industrial designer presented their prototype design , describing the shape and layout of the remote . the group discussed colour options and decided to make the standard remote in fruity colours , but with the option of buying different exchangeable covers which might appeal more to older buyers . the marketing expert led the prototype evaluation and the group were happy with their product . the group calculated the production costs . the group were 4 euros over budget , so they decided to make the case single-curved and not to use kinetic energy . the project manager led the evaluation of the project process . the group felt that only the industrial designer and the user interface designer were able to be creative and work as a team . it was felt that the first meeting was disorganised because of poor leadership but the leadership improved in the later meetings . the group were also had problems with the digital pens . the group helped the project manager fill in the final report before the close of the meeting . the project manager will finish the final report . the remote will come in fruity colours as standard with the option of buying different exchangeable covers . the case will be single-curved instead of double-curved . the remote will be battery powered and will no longer use kinetic energy . the production costs were 4 euros over budget . which features should be changed to reduce production costs . there were not enough opportunities for creativity and teamwork . the digital pens did not work very well .
Generated Summary: the and speech recognition . the designers presented three prototypes to the group and discussed the options for components and the materials used in making the device . the project manager led an evaluation of the prototype . the group discussed the materials and the project process . the industrial designer was instructed to work on the project , and the group decided to use a single-cell battery . the user interface designer was given the option to make the remote more ergonomic and to include a scroll device in addition to the standard buttons . the marketing expert was asked to check the evaluations of the product . the prototype was evaluated on the basis of its look and feel , technological innovation , ease of use , sponginess , and its ability to be misplaced . overall , the prototype performed very well in meeting all the criteria of the evaluation . the remote will be sold for 12.50 euro . the production costs cannot exceed 11.20 euro . one way to prevent the spread of the project's ideas among the group members is to eliminate the extra components that would have to be incorporated into the design in order to stay within the budget .

Reference Summary: the project manager opened the meeting and went over the agenda . the user interface designer and the industrial designer presented their prototype design , describing the shape and layout of the remote . the group discussed colour options and decided to make the standard remote in fruity colours , but with the option of buying different exchangeable covers which might appeal more to older buyers . the marketing expert led the prototype evaluation and the group were happy with their product . the group calculated the production costs . the group were 4 euros over budget , so they decided to make the case single-curved and not to use kinetic energy . the project manager led the evaluation of the project process . the group felt that only the industrial designer and the user interface designer were able to be creative and work as a team . it was felt that the first meeting was disorganised because of poor leadership but the leadership improved in the later meetings . the group were also had problems with the digital pens . the group helped the project manager fill in the final report before the close of the meeting . the project manager will finish the final report . the remote will come in fruity colours as standard with the option of buying different exchangeable covers . the case will be single-curved instead of double-curved . the remote will be battery powered and will no longer use kinetic energy . the production costs were 4 euros over budget . which features should be changed to reduce production costs . there were not enough opportunities for creativity and teamwork . the digital pens did not work very well .
Generated Summary: the project manager opened the meeting and then the user interface designer and industrial designer presented the prototype they created , showing how the device could be used as a telephone remote . the marketing expert gave an evaluation of the prototype and the team discussed the options for components and materials which would make the device easier to use in the hand and to keep the price under 12 and a half euro . after the meeting the project manger discussed the finances of the project , which were calculated using the group's calculations on the smartboard and presented an excel file containing the total cost of the remote , and the group discussed their initial ideas for the device , as well as features they wanted to incorporate into the design . they also had problems with the meeting because of the schedule and had to finish the meeting early and were instructed to fill out the final questionnaire and had not received enough time to discuss their ideas in the meeting-room equipment . all participants will fill out an evaluation at the end of the meeting , the team members will receive a final questionnaire at the remote the remote will have a single touch-screen device with a small display and curved panel . there will be only one remote which will be two colors available in the product , one for the basic remote and another for the advanced menu . a second prototype and second a discussion of the possibility of making a more advanced technologically innovative device than the other devices available for people . once again the group decided that the cost of components was not sufficiently to be .

Reference Summary: the project manager reviewed the decisions from the previous meeting . the marketing expert made a presentation on trend watching , including trends in user requirements and trends in fashion . the industrial designer presented all the components of the device and announced that several of the features already discussed would not be available . he suggested substituting a kinetic battery for the rechargeable batteries and using a combination of rubber and plastic for the materials . the user interface designer presented his main interface design , which included buttons for the most frequently used features and a graphic user interface on the lcd screen for other functions , to keep frequently used features easy to use . he announced that speech recognition was still an option to consider , depending on price . the project manager then began a discussion to decide what was going into the final design . it was decided that a kinetic battery would be used in place of a rechargeable battery , that the remote will feature an lcd screen and rubber casing and rubber buttons , and that interchangeable rubber covers in fruit colors will be available . speech recognition may be included if it is not too costly . it was decided that the remote would feature an lcd screen , rubber buttons , colorful rubber changeable skins , a kinetic battery , and possibly speech recognition if it is still within the budget to include it . several of the features that the group had wanted to integrate into the design were either too costly or unavailable due to new limitations from the factory . the group had to change many of the original design elements to an alternative .
Generated Summary: the project manager opened the meeting by going over the minutes of the previous meeting . the marketing expert presented the results of a trend watching exercise in paris and milan , which showed that people want a fancy look and feel for a remote control device , as well as a technologically innovative and easy-to-use feature . fruit and vegetables are the current fashion for clothes , shoes and furniture , and a spongy feel to materials is a popular choice for remotes . they decided to leave out the voice recognition teletext , leaving out the option to use a flip design , flip-over function , a scroll wheel for recharging and an lcd screen . a buzzer will be included in the remote . voice recognition will not be used . there will be no lprecie-b .

Reference Summary: the project manager reviewed the decisions from the previous meeting . the marketing expert made a presentation on trend watching , including trends in user requirements and trends in fashion . the industrial designer presented all the components of the device and announced that several of the features already discussed would not be available . he suggested substituting a kinetic battery for the rechargeable batteries and using a combination of rubber and plastic for the materials . the user interface designer presented his main interface design , which included buttons for the most frequently used features and a graphic user interface on the lcd screen for other functions , to keep frequently used features easy to use . he announced that speech recognition was still an option to consider , depending on price . the project manager then began a discussion to decide what was going into the final design . it was decided that a kinetic battery would be used in place of a rechargeable battery , that the remote will feature an lcd screen and rubber casing and rubber buttons , and that interchangeable rubber covers in fruit colors will be available . speech recognition may be included if it is not too costly . it was decided that the remote would feature an lcd screen , rubber buttons , colorful rubber changeable skins , a kinetic battery , and possibly speech recognition if it is still within the budget to include it . several of the features that the group had wanted to integrate into the design were either too costly or unavailable due to new limitations from the factory . the group had to change many of the original design elements to an alternative .
Generated Summary: the project manager recapped the decisions made in the previous meeting . the marketing expert presented findings from trend watching studies , which indicated that users want a fancy look and feel , a technological innovation , and a ease of use . the trends also indicated that fruit and vegetable themes are popular among younger consumers , and thus the team should incorporate the theme of fruit and vegetables into their design . the industrial designer presented the interior workings of a remote and discussed options for materials and components . the user interface designer discussed what functions would be controlled through buttons or the lcd screen menu . the group discussed voice recognition , what shape the remote should be , and the option to include a rechargable battery with a locator function . the program manager briefed the team on the new requirements and led them in a discussion in which the team discussed and decided on various features to include in the remote . the team members will work on their individual work the team will not work with teletext . the remote will only be used for televisions . the corporate image must be incorporated into the design of the device . the case will be single-curved . the device will be made of plastic with rubber grips . the batteries will be rechargeable

Reference Summary: the project manager reviewed the decisions from the previous meeting . the marketing expert made a presentation on trend watching , including trends in user requirements and trends in fashion . the industrial designer presented all the components of the device and announced that several of the features already discussed would not be available . he suggested substituting a kinetic battery for the rechargeable batteries and using a combination of rubber and plastic for the materials . the user interface designer presented his main interface design , which included buttons for the most frequently used features and a graphic user interface on the lcd screen for other functions , to keep frequently used features easy to use . he announced that speech recognition was still an option to consider , depending on price . the project manager then began a discussion to decide what was going into the final design . it was decided that a kinetic battery would be used in place of a rechargeable battery , that the remote will feature an lcd screen and rubber casing and rubber buttons , and that interchangeable rubber covers in fruit colors will be available . speech recognition may be included if it is not too costly . it was decided that the remote would feature an lcd screen , rubber buttons , colorful rubber changeable skins , a kinetic battery , and possibly speech recognition if it is still within the budget to include it . several of the features that the group had wanted to integrate into the design were either too costly or unavailable due to new limitations from the factory . the group had to change many of the original design elements to an alternative .

Reference Summary: the project manager reviewed the decisions from the previous meeting . the marketing expert made a presentation on trend watching , including trends in user requirements and trends in fashion . the industrial designer presented all the components of the device and announced that several of the features already discussed would not be available . he suggested substituting a kinetic battery for the rechargeable batteries and using a combination of rubber and plastic for the materials . the user interface designer presented his main interface design , which included buttons for the most frequently used features and a graphic user interface on the lcd screen for other functions , to keep frequently used features easy to use . he announced that speech recognition was still an option to consider , depending on price . the project manager then began a discussion to decide what was going into the final design . it was decided that a kinetic battery would be used in place of a rechargeable battery , that the remote will feature an lcd screen and rubber casing and rubber buttons , and that interchangeable rubber covers in fruit colors will be available . speech recognition may be included if it is not too costly . it was decided that the remote would feature an lcd screen , rubber buttons , colorful rubber changeable skins , a kinetic battery , and possibly speech recognition if it is still within the budget to include it . several of the features that the group had wanted to integrate into the design were either too costly or unavailable due to new limitations from the factory . the group had to change many of the original design elements to an alternative .
Generated Summary: the marketing expert presented the results of trend watching reports from paris and milan . they found that users want a fancy look and feel for a remote control , and that being technologically innovative and easy to use is most important . the group also discussed the look of current remotes , with a preference for fruit and vegetable themes and spongy materials . this lead to a discussion about the port and the use of a scroll wheel on the side of the device , as well as concerns about buttons being too small , which could cause the remote to lose a person if it becomes difficult to locate a lost remote , or if the remote should have an lcd screen . all participants were instructed to fill out a questionnaire and then completed the project manager instructed the user interface designer and the industrial designer to construct the prototype , the interface designer will build a prototype using a model of the prototype the new requirements for the remote and the production cost of the materials , in which they discussed the cost of components and the finalize the features to include in the design . there will be no mention of voice recognition in the new project budget; the group decided to have a flip-shaped remote rather than a larger one of the traditional rectangular remote . it will be made of rubber and not contain a rechargeable battery . having a slide-out button for the , making the remote a small corner of rubbery material .

Reference Summary: the project manager reviewed the decisions from the previous meeting . the marketing expert made a presentation on trend watching , including trends in user requirements and trends in fashion . the industrial designer presented all the components of the device and announced that several of the features already discussed would not be available . he suggested substituting a kinetic battery for the rechargeable batteries and using a combination of rubber and plastic for the materials . the user interface designer presented his main interface design , which included buttons for the most frequently used features and a graphic user interface on the lcd screen for other functions , to keep frequently used features easy to use . he announced that speech recognition was still an option to consider , depending on price . the project manager then began a discussion to decide what was going into the final design . it was decided that a kinetic battery would be used in place of a rechargeable battery , that the remote will feature an lcd screen and rubber casing and rubber buttons , and that interchangeable rubber covers in fruit colors will be available . speech recognition may be included if it is not too costly . it was decided that the remote would feature an lcd screen , rubber buttons , colorful rubber changeable skins , a kinetic battery , and possibly speech recognition if it is still within the budget to include it . several of the features that the group had wanted to integrate into the design were either too costly or unavailable due to new limitations from the factory . the group had to change many of the original design elements to an alternative .

Reference Summary: the project manager reviewed the decisions from the previous meeting . the marketing expert made a presentation on trend watching , including trends in user requirements and trends in fashion . the industrial designer presented all the components of the device and announced that several of the features already discussed would not be available . he suggested substituting a kinetic battery for the rechargeable batteries and using a combination of rubber and plastic for the materials . the user interface designer presented his main interface design , which included buttons for the most frequently used features and a graphic user interface on the lcd screen for other functions , to keep frequently used features easy to use . he announced that speech recognition was still an option to consider , depending on price . the project manager then began a discussion to decide what was going into the final design . it was decided that a kinetic battery would be used in place of a rechargeable battery , that the remote will feature an lcd screen and rubber casing and rubber buttons , and that interchangeable rubber covers in fruit colors will be available . speech recognition may be included if it is not too costly . it was decided that the remote would feature an lcd screen , rubber buttons , colorful rubber changeable skins , a kinetic battery , and possibly speech recognition if it is still within the budget to include it . several of the features that the group had wanted to integrate into the design were either too costly or unavailable due to new limitations from the factory . the group had to change many of the original design elements to an alternative .
Generated Summary: the project manager recapped the decisions made in the previous meeting and briefed the team on some new requirements to consider when designing the remote . the marketing expert presented requirements of users as found in trend watching reports and discussed the results of a company market study which indicated a desire for a fancier look and feel , technological innovation , and a user-friendly interface . the user interface designer presented existing remotes on the market and discussed what features in terms of appearance and usability the team should include in their design . the industrial designer discussed the interior workings of a remote and the team discussed options for energy sources , materials , and chips . the team then discussed features to include in the remote such as voice recognition , an lcd screen , and interchangeable faceplates . the interface designer will work on the interface design the team will not work with teletext . the remote will use rechargeable batteries . the case will be made of plastic with rubber grips . a locator function will also be incorporated into the design , which will allow the user to access the remote when not in use . an extra button will be included for power , volume , channel selection , and speech recognition . the production costs cannot exceed 12.50 euro . the project will consult with the legal department to discuss the prevention of lawsuits from consumers claiming the remote caused rsi the cost of adding speech recognition to a remote will increase if the remote is used

Reference Summary: the project manager went over decisions from the previous meeting . the industrial designer presented the prototype and discussed its look , its internal components , and its interface . the marketing expert evaluated the product according to the initial product goals . the group then decided that enough of this criteria had been satisfied for the project to continue . the project manager presented the final cost of the device which exceeded the initial projected price point . the group decided to remove speech recognition but to propose to the management that it  remain in the design . the group then discussed their effectiveness as a team . all members felt that they interacted well and that they felt they could be creative . the marketing expert felt that the market-research based approach would help the project's success with consumers . the group did express , however , that the budget was overly constraining . the project manager instructed the group to fill out a final evaluation questionnaire . the group will suggest to the management that speech recognition remain in the product design . all members will fill out a final evaluation questionnaire . it was decided that the speech recognition component seemed feasible , so it was added to the prototype design to provide a device locator function . it was removed when the project exceeded its initial budget , but it will be suggested to the management that the speech recognition should remain in the product design . the plastic case will be a neutral color , and the changeable rubber cases will be available in vibrant , fruit colors . the lcd screen will appear only in black and white . the company logo will appear on the inside of the device when opened . the group decided that the device fulfilled enough of the project's initial goals to continue in production . there was a lack of cost information at the beginning of the project . the group did not know how much the features made available to them actually cost until the prototype was constructed; their prototype design may have been different had this information been available at the beginning .
