Reference Summary: the project manager went over decisions from the previous meeting . the industrial designer presented the prototype and discussed its look , its internal components , and its interface . the marketing expert evaluated the product according to the initial product goals . the group then decided that enough of this criteria had been satisfied for the project to continue . the project manager presented the final cost of the device which exceeded the initial projected price point . the group decided to remove speech recognition but to propose to the management that it  remain in the design . the group then discussed their effectiveness as a team . all members felt that they interacted well and that they felt they could be creative . the marketing expert felt that the market-research based approach would help the project's success with consumers . the group did express , however , that the budget was overly constraining . the project manager instructed the group to fill out a final evaluation questionnaire . the group will suggest to the management that speech recognition remain in the product design . all members will fill out a final evaluation questionnaire . it was decided that the speech recognition component seemed feasible , so it was added to the prototype design to provide a device locator function . it was removed when the project exceeded its initial budget , but it will be suggested to the management that the speech recognition should remain in the product design . the plastic case will be a neutral color , and the changeable rubber cases will be available in vibrant , fruit colors . the lcd screen will appear only in black and white . the company logo will appear on the inside of the device when opened . the group decided that the device fulfilled enough of the project's initial goals to continue in production . there was a lack of cost information at the beginning of the project . the group did not know how much the features made available to them actually cost until the prototype was constructed; their prototype design may have been different had this information been available at the beginning .
Generated Summary: the user interface designer and industrial designer presented the prototype they had created and discussed with the group . they discussed using kinetic batteries , a fruit-inspired look and feel , and voice recognition . the marketing expert moderated the presentation and the industrial designer led the group in a discussion of the internal workings of the device . after the meeting the project manager announced that the remote would use a lcd screen instead of a touch screen , which the group felt was too complicated . he suggested using a clip to hold the remote in order to prevent it from getting lost . it was decided to use an rspongy material instead of the traditional rubber buttons and to make it easy to use .

Generated Summary: the marketing expert arrived late and the group started talking about their prototype presentation . they discussed the placement and design of the buttons , and suggested that the on-off button should be at the top of the device . the group evaluated the prototype based on its look and feel , usability , technological innovativeness , ease of use , its ability to control tv and video and its proximity to computers . after the project manager announced that the project would be terminated , the group discussed their final design and the costs of the remote , as well as the possibility to add more buttons to the remote but decided that it was not necessary to have an lcd screen , to have a help button for teletext , switch between channels , change the volume and the sub-left and the right-hand side with a small number buttons . all participants will fill out a questionnaire after they had discussed their initial ideas during the project process , they would like the remote to their computers and the corporate logo and the remote will not feature a scroll wheel . there will be no on- or in-time , but this would require a special button to change channel , in order to make the remote compatible with all television brands . this meeting was held at the end of the group decided that they would be free to spend all their final designs at one another . when they closed the meeting they will go home and will spend all of their final questions at the next meeting .

Generated Summary: the marketing expert arrived late because he was stuck in traffic . the user interface designer and industrial designer presented the prototype of the remote they were to create and discussed its look and feel , usability , and functional design . they discussed adding teletext and subtitles to the remote . after the prototype presentation , the group discussed their initial ideas about the interface design and the number of buttons they wanted to add . then the project manager discussed the project finances and whether the project fit within the twelve and a half euro budget. the group evaluated the project process and found that they were satisfied with the overall score of the project . it was determined that they did not have enough room for the features to include in the remote to include all of the company logo and had already discussed in the previous meetings , but did not want to include the company colors and the logo . there was a lack of a discussion about whether the remote would have a lcd screen . all participants were instructed to fill out a final questionnaire and the team members will fill out the final questionnaire .

Generated Summary: the project manager opened the meeting . the industrial designer presented the prototype design , which featured just a few buttons and a company logo . the user interface designer presented an alternative design for the remote which featured a larger number of buttons . the marketing expert conducted a product evaluation of the prototype . the team found that their prototype was fairly simple and that they could retain all the functions they had originally decided upon without exceeding the project budget . the project then looked at the project finances and had to decide which features to retain or lose in order to stay within the budget . in maintaining the target cost , the team had to lose a number of features which they originally wanted , such as a teletext button and a feature to locate the remote when misplaced . the group evaluated the project process and felt that they worked well together and were pleased with the equipment they had at their disposal . they have to fill out a final questionnaire . the remote will use a simple chip . the case will be double-curved . the buttons will be made of plastic with rubber grips on the sides and rubber buttons on the top of the remote . the production costs cannot exceed 12.50 euro . na .

Generated Summary: the project manager opened the meeting and then the user interface designer and industrial designer presented the prototype , which featured a simple design with only a few buttons . the marketing expert gave the product evaluation , which showed that the functionality of the prototype was satisfied by the group . the group then looked at the project budget and found that everything they wanted to include was within the budget . they also had difficulties with the over budget amount of features . they were satisfied with the prototype design and felt that they had room to be creative , but only after they changed many of the initial specifications . the team then conducted an evaluation of the project process . they found that they worked well together , had excellent teamwork , and were pleased with the product . they will fill out a final questionnaire . the remote will use a simple chip . the case will be made of plastic with rubber buttons on the side and rubber buttons below it . the teletext and channel buttons will be accessed through the channel-changing buttons . there will also be a power button and mute button . the prototype has been evaluated on a scale of 1(excellent)-7(very bad). the criteria used were simplicity of design , technological innovation , ease of use , whether people would be willing to spend 12.50 euro for it , whether it would be easy to find when lost , and whether it meets the group's budget . the final score was 2.6. the group had problems with their computers and much of the meeting-room equipment .

Generated Summary: the project manager introduced the project to the group and gave an agenda for the project as a whole . she then introduced a tool training exercise to acquaint the group with the smartboard and to help them get to know each other . the group each drew their favourite animal on the board . the project manager talked about the project finances and production costs . the group discussed their experiences with remotes and what features they would like to see in the remote they are producing . the industrial designer will work on the working design . the user interface designer will work on the technical functions design . the marketing expert will find the user requirements for the remote the remote will sell for 25 euros . the remote will be sold internationally . the production costs cannot exceed 12.50 euros .

Generated Summary: the project manager opened the meeting and introduced the upcoming project to the team . the team members participated in an exercise in which they drew their favorite animals and discussed why they liked the animal . in the next phase of the project , the technical team members discussed their experiences with remote controls . they also discussed the project budget and which features they would like to see in the remote control they will produce . there will be a discussion about whether the remote should be touchscreen or an lcd screen to complement the remote's appeal to the current remotes and if the remote is capable of controlling video and/audio and video as well as the current one of having a touchscreen remote with a joystick or an LCD display and other functions on the remote . all of the team will work on the technical functions design . however , they will not produce a television nor will be allowed to use a teletext feature .

Generated Summary: the project manager opened the meeting and introduced the agenda . the marketing expert presented some new findings on user preferences and tendencies with remote controls . the research indicated that younger users want fancier and more ergonomic remotes , and that users want the company logo to be recognised more often in the remote . the study also indicated that users think teletext is outdated and should be phased out . the user interface designer presented some questions that should be considered in making the design . the industrial designer briefed the team on the new requirements and led them in a discussion in which the team discussed their target group and made decisions on the energy source and buttons to use in the design of their remote . each team member will complete a questionnaire and a summary . the team will not work with teletext . the remote will only control televisions . the corporate image must be recognizable in the product . the remotes will have buttons for power , channel selection , volume control , numerals , and a few lesser used functions such as an lcd screen . according to the research , the target age group is ages 16 to 40 . teletext will no longer be used .the remote will focus on television only . the company motto should be recognizable on the remote and on the television itself . the younger users of the internet will have a preference for simpler designs and products that have fewer buttons . making the remote a rounded , ergonomic shape and using flashing lights to help locate it when lost . whether to include teletext as a feature

Generated Summary: the marketing expert presented the results of a usability study done by the marketing department . the study showed that users want a remote that only controls television , and that users would rather have an lcd screen , speech recognition , or a fancy looking remote . according to the study , users want buttons that are easy to use , such as switching channels , teletext , volume controls , as well as a large number of other functions . he also suggested that the remote should not include programmable functions such as programming , which were discussed in the group's work on the technical functions of the remote , including a scroll wheel for the , with a bunna spongy appearance , but not necessary to include a locator function in the design . they also discussed the possibility of using a tv rather than a stylusbutton for the television instead of the current one for the other functions and . after the group discussed the project manager's report , the group decided to use the remote only for televisions .

Generated Summary: the marketing expert presented the results of a usability study done on 100 users . the study showed that users want a fancier-looking but uncomplicated remote control , and that younger users want speech recognition . he also found that users wanted buttons for switching channels , the option to use a screen to access a menu containing more information , as well as a faster response time from the remote when misplaced , or buttons for mute/reset , etc. the user interface designer presented examples of two existing products and discussed the importance of each user requirements for the company's design , which he thought the remote should feature the company logo and should be displayed on the home page of the company colours and slogan should be prominent on the front of the design (the remote should not feature speech recognition or lcd screen ). the project manager announced that the team would work on some technical functions and the corporate logo should be incorporated into the design of the remote . all participants will fill out a questionnaire and will work on their individual tasks for the rest of the team's technical functions for the remote will be replaced by an electronic co-powered by an internal battery . every single-programmable channel and number buttons . whether the remote would have a personal computer or if it was not a feature for teletext . how to categorize the company name and logo should appear in the remote's front and be buried in the corporate color of
